The food was delicious. We had no problems with any of it. my first time with duck was a great one. We did run into the standard problem every Asian restaurant is that they never give you enough rice. And given how cheap and easy it is to make, you would think that Asian restaurants would pass out rice like Mexican restaurants pass out tortilla chips. So the food was good and the prices were good too. I think we each payed $15 between the two of us for the meal. I would not mind revisiting this place next time I am in town.

AdzE3MLStgseTEgZC-cmYw.text: I judge Thai restaurants by two things: Thom Kha soup and curry.  Both of these are coconut milk based, and can reveal a lot about a place.  It's easy to cut corners and water down recipes to save a few bucks (coconut milk is pricey, after all).  The good places will have rich, strong flavors in a thick and creamy coconut base.  On the other side of the spectrum, you'll find watery soup and bland curry.  You may have different criteria if you like seafood, or certain specialty dishes... but these two things have always been a very good barometer for me.  I'm very pleased to say that I Am Thai Cuisine exceeded my expectations!  The soup was delicious with large slices of intense ginger, chunks of lemongrass, and whole kaffir lime leaves.  Even more importantly, they didn't skimp on the protein (chicken, in this case).  I also like to see how they handle custom orders, so I requested the yellow curry lunch special without potatoes.  The server offered to substitute other veggies like broccoli and carrots... it was a nice touch, and showed their flexibility and desire to please their customers.  The curry was delicious and full of flavor, just how it should be.  Speaking of service, that's a key component of any good restaurant, and the staff here is great.  Fast, attentive, and very friendly.  I don't usually make a beeline from the airport to a restaurant, but in this case, it's well deserved.  This is definitely my regular Thai spot in LV!

Also ordered the pineapple fried rice and let's just say wow!!! Amazing taste and the presentation is picture worthy! Now making this place one of my must goes when here for work!

qRDB_RxU2P6HuyQEcoStig.text: I had a 5 hr layover from Reno, with final destination to HONOLULU.  I was hungry and didn't want to splurge on airport food.  I thought instantly about looking at reviews. I love Thai food so when I came upon the reviews for Thai Kitchen, it looked so tempting.  I took an Uber (5 min from airport) and looked over the menu again.  I instantly gravitated to the fried red snapper with an apple slaw over it.  The waitress attempted to tell me everything was family style.  I let her know that I was hungry and it would be no problem.  The host and hostess was so cordial. Always paying attention to what I might want or need.  Well, when the fish came, it took less than 10 min to demolish that.  The outside of fish was crunchy yet the inside so moist.  The apple slaw with its sweet, yet savory back end complemented it so well.  Everything was gone (except the head) and I let them know that the chef did an awesome job on the fish.  It's a little hole in the wall with a great ambience. I'd make sure when I get in town that this will definitely be a go to each time.  Aloha 'Oi.

ThsD6dYUns1KN--qkwJuug.text: Great lunch spot for a cheap and delicious Thai fix. Right upon entry, the service was very welcoming and genuine. My friend & I opted for lunch combos. I got the red curry and she got paid thai. The lunch portions are pretty generous for the low cost! Great for a student on a budget like me lol.  My friend enjoyed her dish very much. Seemed like your typical pad thai dish.  My red curry was tasty as well and had lots of veggies. However, I was kind of bummed because I tried to order a spice level 8 & the server would not let me. He said some people in the last week had sent back 4's and 5's for being too hot. I thought to myself "wow, they must make their food really spicy here." So I settled for a 6 as he suggested, and it was not spicy at all -__- I had to dump in several spoons of chili paste to get any sort of kick. I appreciate him trying to watch out for me to not get something too spicy... but ya girl can handle the heat! I was almost offended that he doubted me so much LOL. At least I know next time to take it up a notch so that I can hopefully have a 5-star experience.

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red curry &amp; pad Thai lunch specials

Y-M6723arT5U0-jscHhDNw.text: Quaint neighborhood place.  Sweet staff.  Affordable prices and some good lunch deals.  Loved the Yellow Curry.  Perfect spice - hot and flavor very balanced.  Husband had Pad Thai.  Craving satisfied.  And their Thai Beef Jerky was better than Lotus'.  More tender.

VgE18MRfytkUKVaiZu3bfQ.text: Yummy fresh food, friendly staff, and didn't have to wait long to be served. This will be my go to when I'm in town for sure.

rfYr2NK-inaA30ST1lCVyQ.text: Lots of parking Great service Food ok Clean inside Pretty inside Lots of space inside Prices resonable Pineapple fried rice and coconut shrimp better then expected. Green curry comes with choice of steamed or fried tofu.

lNPoitJJBbUMrjcNCJzBoA.text: Hidden gem.... my girls and I had the fried tofu, Thai dumpling, beef panang and tofu pad Thai.. it was really GOOD!! Service is also excellent. I'll be back again when I'm in Vegas..

geLmO9R5uiI__O1D880MWQ.text: Very good food! I had the  masaman curry and it was the best I've ever had! My husband had a noodle dish that he really loved but I can't remember what it was. Egg rolls were great too. The reason I'm only giving four stars is because they don't have Pinot Grigio. They do have other wines though. Will definitely go back!

6ojHF44vI1_1f2DZLsXPZQ.text: Wow! The cuisine here is so deliciously authentic. Not watered down but the real thing, spiced to your exact preference. We are always fondly greeted with little Thai bows and big Thai smiles. The owner and servers remember us, and do not seem to mind listening to myriad, sentimental stories of my visits to "Amazing Thailand"    The space is very classy. Yes, it could use a little more of that stunning South East Asia decor and perhaps even some lyrical Thai music.    However I love it just the way it is!    The prices are very good, prompt service. The staff enjoys sharing and educating guests on Thailand and about this exquisite food.    Khob kun ka!

NWCBfuWLHEZiyBo5gf7Qpw.text: Food and service was very good. This will be our to go to Thai restaurant when in the area. Ordered Tom Yum soup, pineapple friend rice, pot stickers and vegetable lunch special. Everything was cook perfectly and the amount of heat was great!

ZaFPqz181MHG7CuvWGPyeA.text: Really easy to order off the menu. Restaurants very clean with quick efficient staff. Our party had three entrees and one appetizer.  The stand out dish was the deep fried softshell crab. It was served with two sauces, a sweet chili sauce and a spicy mayonnaise sauce that fit perfect with the crispy crab. Barbecue Thai chicken was very good as well and full of flavor. It really didn't need the spicy sweet chili sauce that was served on the side. Ginger chicken was also very good. It kind of reminded me of a Thai style chop suey.  Really worth the visit I will be back.

juF_Ms-LsbLqZJ5Ej6SdwQ.text: I love this place. I always go here during my lunch break. I have ordered multiple items off their menu (Pad Thai, Pad Se Ew, Panang Curry, Fresh Spring Rolls, etc.) and they did not disappoint. The service is also super friendly. Would recommend this place to anyone craving Thai food!

7i5WR_s4LUkc-04CjJgqnA.text: Some of the freshest food I've ever had and the presentation is always great. Never overcrowded and service is always on point.

HCDo0ytNHhMRoqQNRLD3LQ.text: The food was amazing!! I don't understand how they are not busy. I am very picky with my Thai food especially with curry, they made it perfect down to the spice I like... which is SPICY! I will definitely be coming back as a usual & recommending this place to everyone

3F_QWJWKyyXwUm6yJ2vFkg.text: Just over all great food and great customer service.   The larb was excellent, would definitely order that again.

NhkMIj8SA_nbsAFX1xkSHA.text: This place blew my mind! I will be going back there again!  I would recommend the Pad Thai level 2, with the Chicken Tom Yum Soup level 3!

xtfpH1spp1IsxyVNaW5gHA.text: Very delicious, melt in your mouth flavors, I cannot recommend this Thai place enough! I stopped in on a Thursday night, I.T was pretty slow which was great for me. The seating arrangement is pretty awkward but I was there for food. I had the Seafood Soup and the Pad Thai and both were above par! The customer service was some of the best in the business! Give it a try! Excellent

Qh5Mlnmgcpq08uT6jCd_Cw.text: It was great. The food was made with care and were very aesthetically pleasing. We ordered pineapple fried rice, tamarind duck, egg rolls, and mango sweet sticky rice for dessert. The staff was very helpful and nice, and always came around to see if everything is ok.

2SfrjDy7HCS3ZdFEqhTW2A.text: If you're looking for the amazing flavor of a Thai restaurant delivered right to your door, this is the place for you. Many different flavors and plates to please all types of tongues. We were able to feed 4 people with 4 plates plus rice and sauces. This restaurant sure has a kick to heat the mouthes of all spice lovers. If you are looking for something with not as much heat, be sure to get the mild. The only reason I give it 4 stars is because I prefer Thai sauces to be a bit thicker. Unfortunately the sauces here were a bit runny, but the bursts of flavor make up for it.

66XUZQ3lOXTW8ywJg_UGWA.text: Awesome food & service! I am Thai and this is serious THAI FOOD!! I would recommend to anyone! Prices & portions are great too!

yIvCPSrPTC-qk9m6lMpvKw.text: Very solid tom yum soup, duck, thai tea, and everything else in a very unexpected spot. Skipped the Yelp checkin offer. We were literally the only table there and service was superb.

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2lMBZGk6ByLebv0sxKVg2w.text: One of my favorite Thai places in my neighborhood! Super cute decor and friendly service. My favorite is their rice dishes super flavorful!

-Sy1d2Rthdogw7AoyaKh1Q.text: Please, please, please patronize this locally-owned restaurant.  Best thai food I've had INCLUDING Lotus of Siam and what I ate in Thailand. Whoever's in the kitchen should be made chef of the universe. Seriously, it's that good.  There was a ok-ish thai restaurant in this location previously, but don't think they've just changed signs and started back up under a new name. It's totally different and so, so much better.  The beef jerky is my favorite. It's lean (fat on meat is my nemesis and they take care to only use the best cuts) and incredibly flavorful.  I also love the beef Larb (Laab) at about level 6. Hot but not blow your head off heat. LOL, they're totally going to know who I am just by what food I reviewed. It's practically all I order!  Please help keep this business alive. My tastebuds will really weep if this place doesn't outlive me!

ZX3mBIcwpUed7dP3mtOwrQ.text: I had some time to spare before going to a near by doctor's appointment so I was just driving around the area to see what was around. I saw this spot and was actually craving Thai so I decided to try it.   As soon as I walk in I was greeted by a woman and she seated me right away. I was the only customer in there but then I noticed two gentlemen across the room eating as well. The woman was very polite and got my drink and food order right in. I had ordered beef pad Thai level 6 spice. I had ordered a soda and I drank the first glass pretty fast because come on, it's 100 degrees outside now so I was pretty thirsty haha! The woman saw my glass becoming empty and she refilled it right away.   My pad Thai was brought out in short time and it was delicious. Portion was decent and I really enjoyed my lunch. What really made me want to do a review was because my drink was half empty and one of the gentlemen I saw eating across the room, looked over at me, got up and walked over to me and asked how everything was and if he can get me another refill. I was stunned. This man was on his lunch break probably and decided to do this nice gesture. And really I didn't mind waiting for the woman to come back later or anything.   Customer service was excellent, I was checked up on more than enough, and food is delicious. I will definitely go back.

pu0vrLvoX6A320xRsuhetw.text: I order delivery from them to my office. The food is on point, the delivery always beats the ETA, and the prices are good. My office is in kind of a funny spot and the first time they came out it was tricky to find, but it didn't take long. Now there's no problem. It might seem like an odd thing to point out, but all delivery people always have a lot of trouble with my office and I've had restaurants cancel because they couldn't find it. I Am Thai gives way better service.

s4Q7DWHuAnZpTjyH6DFj3A.text: The best food I've ever tasted . The Thai fried rice is delicious .I come here every time I go to Vegas .

WKrvo15J_oAthj-5AMdiig.text: I have been to this location for pick up twice and each time food was delicious and service was quick and friendly.   Each time I ordered chicken Pad Thai and pot stickers and both times they were great (consistency is important to me!). They always welcome me with a friendly smile and offer candy to take with me. Hopefully one day i'll be willing to try something new on the menu but what i have had is already so good!

8LEshVIIXnLeHrmdpEZtMg.text: Went to this Thai restaurant because it had great Yelp reviews. When you pull up you wouldn't imagine there is an incredible food! I would say this is amongst the best restaurants in all of Las Vegas! We ordered Coconut shrimp, Spicy Basil Chicken, and Yellow Chicken Curry, and Thai Iced tea. All was better than good. This was our first time there and already can't wait to go back!

bvF_HqAnSu2cXq8ZEtbDXg.text: 1st time. Pretty good pad kee mao. Will return for the tom yum noodle soup. Will bring friends.

MO2aIXxmf2IJPg6HrYutcg.text: Tom Kha is my favorite all time Thai meal. I ordered this, and Rad Nar noodle dish with beef. It came hot and I was excited to try a new thai place. WELL..not impressed. My soup had only a few pieces of chicken and barely any mushrooms. Wah. My boyfriend's noodle dish was only so-so, the noodles didn't seem fresh. Nonetheless we ate our food and thought it was ok.   Then this morning I am...diarrhea. And it wasn't from the bacon and eggs I ate yesterday, it had to be the Tom Kha. So pass on this place. The food is mediocre (if you want the BEST tom kha go to Pon Ocha, it's so far from my home but I'd drive there and back all day over this place) and I got a small case of food poisoning. :/ Case closed.

YqC6RyR6uc7pdUmDlxllCQ.text: We had a party of seven - all of us eating here for the first time.  Two people in our party are vegan and one has severe allergies (to nuts, peanuts, and sesame).  Both the greeter and waitress were awesome!  Explaining to the waitress about the allergies, she wrote everything down so as to relay to the chef.  She made sure we all had plenty of water, with cold icy carafes on the table.  Our group ordered Veggie Pad Thai, Chicken Pad Thai, Veggie Fried rice, Veggie Lo Mein, Seafood Lo Mein, BBQ Chicken and rice, Mongolian Beef and Tom Kha.  EVERTHING was delicious.  Cooked perfectly.   I had the Tom Kha and have to say it was so yummy. The flavors were right on spot.   Shared at the end was a beautiful presentation of Mango Sticky Rice. Again - just right on spot and a perfect way to end the meal.   This will be a go back to for Thai.  I haven't had Thai this good in 6 years.  Something to consider - this restaurant doesn't use Thai chili powder or paste - they use fresh Thai pepper - it's HOT.  So when the waitress says their 5 is a 10 at other restaurants - believe her.  They will bring fresh Thai chili to the table if you need.  I had a 4 and it was plenty.

7-tQIxGrdHCKnBtzoUnFSw.text: They have a creative menu. I love the sweet taste of the yellow chicken curry and the pad thai is delicious with shrimp! I have eaten here a couple of times and now will make sure to eat here more often. Affordable yummy thai food!! I would definitely recommend them to all!

uQC3r3cd9pGeYlRyrAmYLw.text: Over-priced, small portions, bugs, nasty people run this place.  Very angry manager etc.  Food was way too oily as well,  Better places close by,

rGcb9Rd_lcmdG3l43SubvQ.text: Food was delicious!! Service was a little slow but we were a large party. We called them about 5 mins. ahead of time and by the time we got there they were expecting us. Definitely going again :)

8IT0jdbFnpfk4PZhgZDZzQ.text: This is a solid Thai restaurant.  I ordered the Pad Thai with chicken.  It was good and the service is very accommodating.  Any local or out of towner should visit this place.

nsPHjtRdQmzz_f0eEidcKw.text: I feel the burn! if you like spicy this place will not fall you. fyi, 'not spicy' still has a kick to it. overall, loved the service & food. I shall return! and their Thai tea is delicious as well.

j4Akfi-vykCeGPBhL7hScQ.text: Best Tom kha I've ever had.  They spice on a scale of 1 to 10, and they say 3 is medium.  So math is not their strong suit, the pad that is.  I ordered it spiced to 5, and the waitress thought I was nuts.  But it was very tolerable.

BKDyvFBIKLkD1pJARdht_Q.text: The restaurant has nice modern decor. The service is a little slow, so I wouldn't advise coming here on a work lunch hour. The food was all very good. My friend had the lunch pad thai- heat level 2- and said it was excellent. The egg drop soup was the best she has tried in Las Vegas. I got the Chow Mien lunch plate - heat level 2. It was very flavorful and cooked perfectly. Next time I will go up to a #3 heat level. My salad was good, and the dressing was yummy.

-WxT-cBkBOYqse9tANUNLQ.text: I order the pineapple fried rice it's was pretty good. My friend order the pad Thai she says there was barley any flavor. Restaurant was clean staff was nice. I would definitely go back.

XY0J7joPtbaDfNd-4uho0g.text: Best Thai food I've had in a long time. We ordered the yellow tofu curry, pineapple fried rice, and veggie pad Thai. Excellent flavor. Sever was prompt and happy to help us with questions regarding our orders. Will definitely be returning! Highly recommend the yellow curry!!

0D6z5CT5fU8t3WrtgSIWOw.text: Awesome food, friendly staff and great value for money.  Will highly recommend this place.

caBxLf89r1wg6kLsezO6OA.text: Food was delicious! We really came to check out the food they serve in the pineapple (which was good) but everything else was yummy! The shrimp rice was the best I have to say. Definitely will come back when I'm in Vegas.

POvIoTfRA9_QgYiepQ8s3g.text: Delicious food. Good service. But a bit small portion compare to other thai places I've been.

r7uiGIHk90MPHhYUiUXagw.text: The Thai food is good . Was a little upset with the service,  my waiter couldn't describe any of their dishes , I mean AT ALL.   And she took my plate whislt I was still eating.

ctCgcnJrHRQP8k7KDN85Zg.text: Not the best Thai food I've eaten but certainly not the worst. If you want really food Thai food go to Thai chili  in green valley. I am Thai is just meh in comparison food wise. I love food. Food is life. I am Thai is not life. Sorry guys.

VczZpOPUYObhgyAVqju75g.text: They served me a dry& hard chicken, too dry I almost choked. I returned it, the manager asked if I would like to order something else, I declined. Instead they offered me a half off price of a meal that I couldn't eat. Unbelievable.

FedySRL91LQOAV6Hkcr_rA.text: The place was nice, their food is good. The only part I wasn't a fan of was the fishy taste of the shrimp mixed in the Sweet and Sour Thai Entree, I believe it wasn't cooked thoroughly.

WOeT-28iUn1tH7ViXvwk-Q.text: Just ordered take out online & it's going in the trash. Ordered panang curry "mild" & it's so spicy that I can't eat it...tastes like a 7 or 8. Ordered Thai ice tea "no ice" ha ha full of ice. Ordered Mongolian beef but "where's the beef?" two small slices.

7Mu3SnYcpU1CA4thCIwCWw.text: Crab fried rice really good. Order it every time. Never disappointed. Thai tea is good. Scollop also good...Yummy. Many time ordered the Crab fried rice for delivery. Hmm. Still the same. Yummy. And the beef salad also really good!

c4K6H_qR5b8PNAkD1f2yRg.text: I love Thai food! This place did a great job fulfilling my Thai fix! Food came out hot, super flavorful and relatively good timing. Staff was nice.   There was a little miscommunication on one of the items. I ordered the fish with apple salad. From others previous posts I thought I would be getting a whole fried snapper but I received fish fillets instead. Despite being a disappointed in. It getting what I thought I would, the fish filets were cooked well and the portion was generous. The salad on top was fresh and seasoned well. I just really wanted the whole fried fish. So make sure to specify!   Thai tea was a little too milky and we asked for a bit more of the tea it self to make it stronger which they were happy to accommodate.  I, myself am not a fan of Las Vegas tap water. So get bottled or order a drink!   Enjoy!

V7F4WPkb4NzpTMD_aYlW2g.text: Spectacular food. We ordered Pad Thai and Pineapple Curry for take out. The people were very friendly, the food was prepared rather quick and it was packed to stay hot. Most importantly, the food was delicious and the portions were quite large.

umTzIY0gcItzpvBXLLyOxg.text: This Thai place is highly recommend! Excellent service, very quick on getting appetizers out and meals. Very exceptional food and it fresh and amazingly tasteful. One the best Thai places we have ever been to. They are so helpful!  The server was great    Very clean atmosphere, greets with a smile.

DVipCjMQZ_EeGYXYZ3UJqg.text: Best Thai food I've had outside of Thailand. Chu Chee is one of my favs and lots of places don't have it or don't do it well. I switched the scallops for shrimp and they included crab, I thought I'd died and gone to Thai food heaven! All the meats, we got shrimp chu chee, pork panang, chicken Tom yum, and shrimp spring rolls were fabulous and not over cooked, which is a peeve of mine. I loved how the curries came with rice, lots of places charge for rice and the delivery was so easy, on time and the driver was so sweet. My only feedback is the the spring rolls were quite small, like two bites per roll. The sauce for them was awesome, just used to a more filled roll. All in all I'll dream of this place until I return again!

exgz9d2V06AS3HE6zk83Fw.text: For being a 4.5 star restaurant I was definitely underwhelmed!  Menu is fairly decently priced.  We had the pad thai and pad see ew.  Surprisingly the food was only decent.  They offer many levels of spicy and I opted for the mild which wasn't very spicy at all.  It was a decent sized portion.  The service here seemed kind of mom and pop and was extremely slow.  For being half empty, waiting 15 minutes for 2 noodle dishes is pretty bad.  They also have a free green thai tea if you have a yelp check in! I asked for just the green tea part which the waitress seemed to understand, but I was still gifted with the green thai tea free of charge.  I tasted it and and expected it was super sweet and i didn't touch it after that.  We were killing time waiting to pick someone up at the airport but I probably won't be coming back.

-vjEehAFfQsJQePt6JtAcw.text: Worst place in LV.   Came here after a quick visit to the outlets. Looking for something to eat near by, my best friend and decided to come here after seeing the reviews.   First off, it's located in a shady strip mall that looks abandon. Outside and inside interior needs a big makeover. Walked in, got seated and was legged waiting for over 15 minutes without anyone coming to check on us. Not even water. It wasn't even busy either.   We were so hungry and after no one approaching us after a long wait we walked out... they didn't even see us leave since they were busy doing other things.   I'm never in this part of the city to begin with. Never again.

7Lo8OJbeFkVKp4PmQ1ax_Q.text: I've eaten at multiple Thai restaurants this one has the best fried rice. Chicken Satay and Potstickers are a must try. The portions are good for 2 people or 1 very hungry person. Excellent service and the staff is very courteous and answer all questions with a smile.

WaE0ikgbe7jMQ1Lv1g4SPA.text: This is one of my favorite places! The BEST service I've ever had at a casual restaurant. Everyone is so friendly, I would still eat here if the food was just ok. Fortunately the food is delicious! Tom Kha and Thai fried rice are my favorite. Don't forget some Thai iced tea!

04Lzg3xVGpy_r8_0WBBuMA.text: This place is terrific. The first bites of the pad see ew shot me back to Pattaya, Thailand. The servers were friendly and prompt to take our order. The decor was subtle and beautiful. If you want a nice sit down Thai restaurant look no further.   The server was good about warning us about their above normal spice levels. I ordered a two(usually order a five out of ten) and it was perfect.   My lady ordered the pad Thai and it was perfect. I was going to ask for a lime since it was missing but the flavor was there.   The sticky rice and mango was slightly below par. The mango had seen better days but the presentation was nice. One rice chunk was in the shape of a heart, the other in the shape of a star.   BEST THAI ICED COFFEE IVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE.  Will return to try the curries.

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Thai iced coffee I have ever had. $2.95
Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ciLk8IYl9xK5QTji1OygOA.text: We were in Vegas for a few days and got tired of the restaurants on the main strip. We found this spot through yelp and reviews. We decided to give it a shot. Every item that we ordered was cooked to perfection. This place has amazing food and great service.   When we initially arrived to the restaurant it looked a bit sketchy because other than us there was only one other family. However, we realized it's around 3 pm and highly doubt people go this far to eat at this time. Once the food was served we knew that we made the best choice.    This place is highly recommended to anyone that is a True foodie for Thai food. We enjoyed everything. No complaints.  Thank you "I Am Thai" for the great experience and filling our tummies with your most amazing food.

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NIl76g-cVG8Uah7cYzIL8w.text: We ordered via Yelp and was sad when we arrived 30 minutes later only to find out that the order had just been called in as we walked in. The gentleman assured us it would only be 10 minutes or so and our food would be ready so we sat and waited.   The food was good. My panang curry chicken was lacking. In what I wasn't sure. I am used to having green beans etc in it and to me it was more like regular curry. The spice level on my curry was perfect but the rest of my families was way over spiced considering I ordered it light spice.  The containers/ serving sizes were in the smaller side but was enough.   All in all the food and ease of pick up was good but nothing special. Not sure I would go out of my way again to pick it up and would order delivery from a closer to home establishment.

4KNSRGZW9meg0frLibKtSw.text: I've been here a couple of times, and the food is delicious! The only thing that lacks a little bit is the service. It just takes a moment to get seated and to get things started, but I'm patient and don't get too upset over those things so it's not a huge deal with me. Also definitely note that this place makes food spicier than usual! 1-10, but 3 is mild! So be mindful

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Pad Thai lunch special with an egg roll and soup. So yummy, and a generous portion!

lrCsAdK721FJ8We4JHneBA.text: A solid go to place for Thai near the house. The food is solid and the staff is friendly!

aDm6-sZ7WSbYHz_0p5rrFQ.text: PS: flew in for work 11/13/2017, yelp says they close at 10 pm her actual time is 930 pm. Came straight from the airport and arrived at 940.  Recognized one of the workers leaving and asked if they were closed already. They closed at 930 and I hopped in my car to leave. He came up to the window and offered that I could grab a to-go order. Heck yeah! Love this place. Great service, excellent food.   Original review: Holy heck! Stumbled on to this place via Yelp reviews. What an amazing find! The outside of the place does it absolutely no justice. I almost didn't come in. It's in a strip mall, dark exterior, nothing bright or welcoming about it. I'm so glad I took the chance and came inside. The food and service are both exceptional. If I could give it eight stars instead of five, I would. Word of warning! Listen to the wait staff when they say their spice rating is spicier than most. Fabulous meal from start to finish!

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut ice cream. Worth going up an entire size in clothing. At the bottom of the ice cream is sweetened sticky rice. Amazing.
Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cashew chicken. Yum!!!
Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extra spice in case my lips on fire wasn&#39;t enough!

vxBWqhSo4Q5L9U8E6niUzg.text: Great place, not too busy on a Saturday and food came out fast. Pineapple curry was amazing. Thai tea didn't disappoint either and it's great they offer the yelp check-in for free drink.

LLV1Tpqe3_1D_EX1l-Gp4g.text: To give y'all context, I am visiting Vegas. I'm not a local and am from socal. The only reason I'm giving this place a four stars is because of the musty smell in the restaurant. Once we got the yummy food, the smell was forgotten, so it wasn't extremely pungent, but it was definitely there. Hopefully they are just in the middle of fixing something as it can be off putting.  Regardless, we chose to come here due to the great reviews and we were not disappointed with the food or service.  Service was great. The servers were all friendly and promptly fulfilled our requests.  Food--the food came out in a timely manner and was all really delicious. We ordered: pad thai, pad see ew, pineapple fried rice, yellow curry, green curry fried rice, massaman curry, and spicy basil chicken. All dishes were very delicious--I personally have no complaints at all. We had a great meal and this is a great place to eat off the strip that's affordable. :)

gF6niPCYJS08FD8ntquQ4w.text: The best thai place I've ever been. Ordered Crab fired rice,Crispy pork with Chinese broccoli,  pad thai and beef jerky. All so delicious. With will definitely come back and my favorite thai place.for now. We will recommend this place.for sure.

RSO-LtMqc5OFvRBQjklHdw.text: This is my first time ordering takeout from this restaurant.  I ordered Kow PAd/Thai Fried Rice via the Yelp app.  The app said that it would take an hour for the order to be ready.  We walked in and were told 10 mins.  Overall the food was good. 1MimlTBfiX7IYfpyKPy1wg.text: FABULOUS!!! We just ate dinner at I am Thai tonight and all of us loved it. While visiting Las Vegas for vacation, I decided to go to a Thai restaurant off the strip (Thai food is my favorite type of food-see other reviews by me). I chose this place because it had very good reviews and it certainly did not disappoint. Not only was the food very delicious, but what made it so great was the extremely friendly staff. It was a True pleasure to eat there because they were so nice. It was seven of us so we ordered a good amount of food. The waitress was very nice and honest when we asked if what we ordered was enough food. It wasn't an insane amount of food for seven but I thought it was just right. The portions are quite large so even though we did not order seven full entrees, it was enough. We ordered two small soups, tom yum shrimp and tom kha chicken. We also got papaya salad and thai dumplings as appetizers. For our main meal we got tofu pad thai (a choice of fried or steam tofu-I chose fried), chicken pad thai, pineapple fried rice (which is served in a pineapple!), and massaman curry with shrimp. For dessert we got fried banana with coconut ice cream. Everything was very very very delicious (see pictures for large portions and beautiful plating!) I would definitely recommend going here, if you are a tourist or a local. It is a great place with delicious food, friendly and inviting staff, and low prices.

3QH-JJyCWWVbgVS3Ifgtyw.text: Walked in and the place was deserted.  We could hear voices from the kitchen.  There's a bell on the counter and we rang it and patiently waited.  Again we rang the bell after a minute or so.  And a third time.  Finally, frustrated and about to leave, I just continually rang the bell until someone came out from the kitchen.   I'm sure it's loud back there and they didn't hear.  But still,  for any restaurant, that's going to lose you customers.    Once we were greeted by someone the service was fantastic.  We ordered Thai Iced Teas which were both free since we checked in on FB and Yelp.  We enjoyed those while we perused the menu, which looked amazing.  We ordered Pad Thai for the kids, my wife ordered the Pad See Ew, and I got the Pad Kee Mao.  The kid's Pad Thai arrived first and we all sampled it:  hot, flavorful and delicious!    My noodles came next, delicious flavor, but for some reason, not hot...  Lukewarm.  Not outright cold but definitely not fresh off the wok.  Like maybe my plate had sat there for a few minutes prior to them bringing it out.  My wife's noodles were hot, though, and temperature aside, the flavor was excellent and I imagine if my noodles had been hot I would be writing a 5 star review right now, despite the hang-up at the entrance.  Sadly,  I can only honestly give this place 4 stars with the caveat that this was probably just a one-off issue that doesn't happen often.  We WILL be back and I hope to have a more seamless experience next time.  They've only been open a week and are probably still working some kinks out of their system.  Great food and people.  Definitely worth checking out.  Room for improvement, but I'm sure this will be a place we come to regularly.

thitHz07IZ3UGw9CZjfRug.text: My husband and I have found our thai restaurant of choice when visiting Las Vegas. We dined at I Am Thai twice in two days and loved everything that we tried.   It was my dad's birthday and I was in search of a restaurant that could accommodate 24 people with one day notice. After contacting various restaurants, Joey of I Am Thai was the most responsive and helpful. He allowed us to create our own customized menus and provided exceptional pricing. We interacted via telephone call and text to make sure we were on the same page. I truly appreciate the time and help that was provided...  I Am Thai has your typical thai menu items; however, the authenticity and flavor of their dishes sets them aside. I'm talking about a whole other level. A few favorites are their crab fried rice, pineapple fried rice and pad thai.  Crab Fried Rice:  This was my favorite dish. Unlike other restaurants that use imitation crab, I Am Thai stuffs their fried rice with real crab chunks. They are not greedy with their crab either; there is a good amount inside the dish. The price is very reasonable considering the size of the dish and the real crab that they use. Delicious!!  Pineapple Fried Rice:  The presentation of this dish is already a plus. There is fried rice served inside of a full size pineapple (the remaining fried rice that didn't fit inside is served on side of pineapple). This fried rice was flavorful and sweet. It's like the juices of the pineapple penetrate into the fried rice. It's more on the sweeter end, but was a hit. You can definitely taste the pineapple flavor  Pad Thai: Perfectly cooked pad thai! We tried with chicken and another time with shrimp. I Am Thai is not greedy with their protein...they provide a very generous amount of meat (or tofu) of choice. We ordered a spice level of 3 and it was perfect for my taste buds. The spice was more than mild, but still manageable to eat for me (I can't handle too much spice without my nose running and lips burning).   Everyone enjoyed their meals and continued raving about the goodness of the crab and pineapple fried rice dishes (half favored the crab better and the other half favored the pineapple). Along with the excellent food, the customer service at I Am Thai is top notch. A+ all around...every employee that we interacted with was very pleasant and helpful!   We'll be back for sure!! Thank you again Joey and I Am Thai for a memorable bday luncheon for my dad!!

QopoI2fXkMuwV1DENOn-tQ.text: We ordered the following for take out:  Pineapple curry- very delicious. Would eat again. Panang curry- the portion was very small and it was very spicy. Pad see ew- better than the pad thai but the noodles were very dry. I don't know if they sat for a while or what.  Pad thai- also super dry and almost a little too sweet.  I've had the two noodle dishes at other places before and while I know that they're not supposed to be super saucy I do expect a light coating of sauce on the noodles. These were bone dry. When we got there to pick up our order was ready except for the panang curry so maybe while they waited for that the noodles got dry.   Another thing I didn't like was that they give regular steamed white rice instead of jasmine rice with the curry dishes. That was kind of a let down.   I would definitely try them again though. I'm sure they're much better when you dine in.

Cp8s25du8P_PIXUpCBfsuA.text: We visited this place today based off the ratings on yelp.  Unfortunately, I feel the ratings are inaccurate to the quality of Thai food we received today.  I am not saying the food was horrible because it was not, but based on the price point and ratings and reviews I expected much more than what we were served.  I would say based on the quality, the dishes were about $3 to $4 over-priced.

5oEwhbB1gBKLns1-T2shlw.text: Yummy Thai food, 2nd time visiting while vacationing in Vegas (& wanted to get off the strip for local hole-in-the-walls).  Both times, the yelp check-in earned us free drinks with each entree.  Last year it was a matcha green Thai tea while this time, it was a traditional Thai iced tea.  Pineapple fried rice was tasty and actually came out in a pineapple shell.  Wish the spring roll order was larger for the price (presentation almost made up for size). Silver noodle dish came out way too salty so we sent it back - returned much better and glad staff was accommodating.  Last trip, the mango sticky rice dessert was sweet and a fave of our toddler.

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls (4 pcs) &amp; silver noodles

bcTrA9vyCEeph_z_-nIU6A.text: Pretty good food! Nice services and our servers helped pick out everything right. The chicken satay here is different from some I had back home and nowhere near enough meat and very subpar, but the main course basil meal I got was amazing. I also liked their milk tea and tore it down quick. It was a little TOO sweet but I still liked it!  Also, it was really funny because I wanted the spiciest possible they had and the server looked really worried and said "were a lot spicier than most Thai food places out here." But as it turns out - they're still nowhere near as spicy as go sy thai's "top of the line" back at home. Lol.   They really took care of us though. So I was satisfied with everything. Definitely check this place out.

VtOJaSJ8LsNgficqL6c2mw.text: Wonderful friendly service. Good food.  The pepper steak was delicious, but the star were the dumplings. Yummmm

rpVW6trdUxxPjlcYccQDsw.text: Delicious! My husband ordered chicken Pad Thai and I ordered Pad See Wen with chicken and add-on mushrooms. We also ordered crab rangoons as appetizer. Everything arrived freshly prepared and so very yummy. Recommend dinner here for visitors and locals

52CObVRrdyPIAq2k3AFQZA.text: I came here on a Sunday night with the entire family in tow. The yelp reviews and photos looked promising. It wasn't too busy when we arrived so we were seated immediately and was able to order after a quick scan of the menu.  We ordered: Large Tom Yum Soup, salmon with Thai chili sauce, pad see ew with tofu, cashew but chicken, papaya salad mild, panang with Tofu, and Thai style fried rice with shrimp.  The soup was nice and sour and the shrimp was large. It was served in a bow and not one of those flaming hot pots. I think they made it with too much fish sauce. The Thai fried rice was good but was slightly sweet (it would taste better with more lime), the panang with tofu had good consistency but was way too sweet, the salmon was fried so it was kinda dry and the sauce it came with too spicy (I'm glad I order the sauce on the side), the pad see ew was ok too but also made slightly too sweet. I think my husband liked the papaya salad but he's not a picky eater, and the cashew nut chicken was also just ok and since it was made with pineapple the sweetness was expected. The yelp check in Thai iced tea was overly sweet. I couldn't finish it and was glad they had water already poured for us. Overall this place was ok. It's not great but not horribly bad either. The service was prompt and friendly. But I felt that for the portions (which was on the smaller side) a bit expensive. Total bill came out to $115 with tip included.

atHRWOdKbP11Di-OCmwIlg.text: My favorite Thai spot that never disappoints! Recently moved to the area and it's down the street. I always order the crab ragoons, yellow curry, and pan see ew (medium) and they never make it over spicy. Usually ready in twenty minutes and staff is always friendly.

Uj-qUhSXZ636RVxBDAlJcA.text: Fantastic Thai! Kind of tucked away, the interior is a nice quiet and quaint dining room. The food is top quality and the service is fantastic. Great prices for a good amount of food. I would highly recommend for some good quality Thai that will certainly fit the budget. Check it out!

EoSdhU9NPlt3mItkANTy0g.text: This was a great find in Vegas! My huge family got together for dinner and we were scrambling to find a Thai restaurant that could accommodate us last minute. Service was great. There was not a dish we didn't enjoy - chicken satay, fried shrimp, pad Thai, fried fish, tom yum soup, curry, mango sticky rice, etc.  We had so much fun here. I will come back on my next Vegas trip!

m5Q84QHd-EXjvyriH5qvkw.text: It is difficult to not over indulge at I am Thai due to the reasonableness of their prices coupled with delicious food. They are extremely budget friendly, yet do not skimp on flavor or portion size. They are one of my go tos to order take out from during my 90 Day Fiance binge watching days/evenings. Our go to favorites from this establishments are typically Yam Woon Sen, Spicy Catfish, Roasted Duck Curry and their generous portion of Tom Yum Soup. Most of our experience consists of take out, but our orders were always timely and correct and staff always courteous. I always end up with left overs due to their generous portion sizes and I am very much okay with that. From the dishes I mentioned above I cannot say that I have a single complaint about any of them. I am certainly a fan, and Thai food being my favorite, they will stay in my rotation of go to Thai places.

QBLQOTymSmUGiVX362VL9A.text: Our family of four came here on a Saturday night. We are staying at the Oasis RV Resort and this is within 5 minutes. It was excellent. In order of favorites... Panang Curry with Chicken - spectacular. Starts off sweet and ends with a kick. Fresh rolls - clean and great Won ton soup - it was smooth and good as a shared starter. Crispy Pork with Chinese Broccoli (a recommended favorite not on the regular menu) - - the vegetables are amazing, the wontons were incredible, the pork was a little too overdone. Service was perfect and there is plenty of room. Saturday night and not too busy. They do a big to go business it looks like. Highly recommend the curry dishes! Price was cheap for Vegas.

X3Fht2WNi-rcWWSqqnNUbg.text: Guieuniely extremely surprised that such an authentic Thai restaurant is first of all, located here, and secondly, amazing flavor and variety.   If you're returning your rental car to LAS, this is the place to be. It's literally right across the street from the rental car center AND next to the gas station. So fill her up and them fill yourself up before heading out on your flight.   You wouldn't expect this quality and authenticity in this location. It's just a pretty dead strip mall, but I Am Thai is clearly located in the corner of the lot. You're greeted by a huge set of double wooden doors. Once you walk in, it's huge inside and super spacious. I love that the tables aren't slammed right next to each other and there's enough person space between you and the next table.   The staff was super friendly, especially on Christmas Eve! The menu was extensive and they had a good amount of pictures there too. You can tell that this place was legit and the staff spoke Thai as well. There are specials but we opted for the classic pineapple fried rice and pad see ew.   Luckily for us, this fried rice didn't have raisins in it! It came packed into a pineapple with a great flavor and decent amount of shrimp, and the rice that didn't fit, it came on another plate. The pad see ew was super delicious! Noodles were soft and not hard, jump packed with flavor and a good portion of protein!    Two entrees was a lot of food even to share, and I eat a lot! Oh, best part, when do you a Yelp checkin, you get a free Thai iced tea and that portion was huge for a free drink! In fact, they even tell you that your thai tea is free if you check in on Yelp!   Overall, I was super impressed by the food quality and the portions. It was a great vibe inside and definitely one for the books in terms of Thai food in Las Vegas.

LfbDaeCo5vzjWfxTxA97ew.text: Again the best service, awesome food From Hawaii and just the best!!! Fried tofu , satay chicken and the pad Thai !

sUMJESAn49zCm2hwVGDYAg.text: Some coworkers & I were in the mood for Thai & I found this place within 10 minutes from my work! We ordered for pick up the lunch chow mein, the Thai beef salad & pad see ew & they were all delicious! I checked in for the free Thai green tea & it was great! The lady that rang me up when I went to pick up the food was sweet & friendly. The restaurant itself is very well put together. I'll have to sit in & dine next time.  We will definitely be putting them into our rotation for lunch time.

yr8YFyokfghg0BydnLLMcA.text: Thought it would be my new favorite place. But they keep doing weird things with the food. I ordered soup and curry both at level 6. Curry was more like a 10 and soup was like a 6. Almost mo flavor in the curry other than heat..... what happened to the incredible flavor????  Don't know what level to order next time. Probably a 3 because although I like it spicy I don't want a 10.  Also last time there was more onions than chicken in my curry....  consistency is what keeps people coming back.  Get it right!

1o-w5puBc0gQp0rQbOTv9Q.text: This place is such a gem. Little spot just south of the airport. Their red curry and Pad See Ew is really great. Thai iced tea is okay. They're always super quick on the takeout which is helpful. It's a reasonably priced place and just as good as the rest in the area.

8734fJ4eUgqVC4_eBdInWg.text: We ate here a few nights ago- it is tucked into a small shopping center where I wouldn't have noticed it, but it is exactly as most of the other reviewers state- super delicious food and the wait staff was prompt and friendly. We had a few different dishes, and all were delicious. Order lower on the heat scale than usual- I had a 4, and it was quite spicy! We will be back!

WH3vKSlskg7KK2fCefAZpQ.text: Amazing Thai food at a good price.  Plus the new online ordering app is so easy to get delicious Thai cuisine right to my door!

KhrtgvuzQg2KKAXJBwP2lA.text: My favorite Thai place in Las Vegas (I go to LV monthly to visit family and every time!  I order from I am Thai- I've never actually been to their restaurant).    Ultimate favorite is their glass noodle dish (sorry I don't know the Thai name) but it is fantastic!  Flavorful and fresh (though not sure if it's healthy- who cares?).  Their Panang beef is superb as well (another favorite).  I once ordered 6 dishes from here (phad Thai, assorted fried rice, basil chicken and I can't remember what else).  Everything was great.  Be careful though..mild spicy is actually medium to hot spicy...so don't be a hero!

g9eg8r2LhZDmt_ikrVGC1Q.text: Not sure how they're can be negative reviews for this place. We drive up from San Diego twice a year and come to this place all the time when we're in town. Food is phenomenal! Pad Thai is one of the best I've ever had. Loved their papaya Salad, crab fried rice, Thai tea, mango sticky rice!!

wdW-hPgWpan2DkNjh_rwEw.text: I ordered soft crab and shrimp pad thai. Soft crab had minor smell but wasvokay to eat. But pad Thai was overcooked. It was moosh. Not sure this is Vegas style but I miss the original Thai style.

SwHhUubZthYBahMk9QMBkQ.text: The food here is delicious. All the food was amazing and well seasoned. I can recommend people coming here.

Ecgw-GzGApaGw8iSKyFRqA.text: This is the best Thai food outside of Thailand. Grab prices and gray food.  Dining area is a bit small,  but it is great find. I have done cooking classes and took several trips to Thailand, I am usually disappointed by food here in the states.  Glad I found this place.

njIQkGUGxlf5dS73YZYxrA.text: Very good place, great food, great service. Nice little hole in the wall place. Looked small from the outside, but very spacious on the inside.Loved the thai green tea. Highly recommend this place

gZ6kaGkkaU7krPNOmCewJA.text: Good food from a nice local place I never new existed!  Ordering again as we speak :)

bOuJ3ahbiIVZsxp3WTKPRg.text: I am super sick & congested and wanted a SPICY soup to clear me up. Two spoonfuls in my nose is running and my mouth is on fire! It's so hard to come by Thai restaurants in America that actually do THAI HOT spice levels. I am Thai did not disappoint, my congestion is clear after finishing my beef broth (spice level 10). I also got larb and the flavor and spice level is also on point. Tastes like home. I'll definitely be back!

Qbs3e4PBLzi4pRF0fVNGEg.text: Wow! One of the best Thai restaurants I've had! I'd definitely come back here again the next time I'm in town. The Thai Green Tea is a nice twist to the original, but super sweet!

U8kP5_joUwzo4HM2uU20ow.text: Was sitting in the cold winter with the Las Vegas breeze blowing in my face... I was overly waiting for my girl friend to pick me up, so I was freezing my tail off. I was also starving and felt of the need of some soup. The first thing that popped up in my head was some Tum Yum.... so I yelped some thai restaurants near me, and this place popped up. All the pictures looked amazing, so I felt more confident going here other than some other yelp experiences. And let me tell you....THIS PLACE DID NOT DISAPPOINT!!! I will definitely be coming back to try other dishes...

rzkI_2Smvn5xhiqcI8K_eg.text: Ordered Padseew Beef, Penang ck curry, and Thai fried rice. It's hard for me to find a good Thai place as my family grew up eating good Thai/Lao food. This food was really really good. Definitely coming back. So glad I finally found a good Thai restaurant near home.

fIDEtGQG4_8-kMk6yBbM-w.text: I have eaten at most Thai restaurants in the surrounding area and this is by far the best. In fact it's the best Thai place I've eaten at in Las Vegas. Their Pad Thai and Larb are probably the best things I've had. And I've eaten quite a few dishes here. Now this place is spicy. They do warn you if it's your first time coming here. They aren't joking. At other Thai places I can eat a 7 or 8 no problem here I get like a 4 or 5. But the spice is great tasting and isn't just hot with no flavor. Eat here. You won't regret it....unless you make your dish too spicy.

w1P0itGIsxCPAHNHVVRQtg.text: Very tasty food, friendly staff, good portions. We actually went back a second time in the 4-5 days we were at Vegas.

0eyboEUf3PkSDIpHy774Nw.text: Ordered to go from here and I wasn't overly impressed especially given its high rating. The plus was that it was done exceptionally quick, but the food wasn't my favorite especially with so many other Thai options in the area I probably won't order again. I ordered the pad kee mao with tofu which was actually quite good and had amazing flavor. I'm giving the lower rating for my boyfriends dish, the pad see eiw because it was lacking in flavor and didn't really have any eggs in it compared to other places. We also got the tom yum soup which I again wasn't super impressed with.

c3EgJDw4k2cpoKtv5lU1nA.text: So good! I ordered delivery because I prefer Thai food while watching Homeland in my underpants. My first experience was awesome. Quick, hot delivery and my food was delicious! I ordered the red curry and the steamed dumplings and it was all so, so good. My brown rice was perfect and I can't wait to try more of their items!

SVr2y1hbjbxSvm9alYo6zQ.text: Oh my goodness the foot here is great, reasonably priced, and cheerfully delivered by lovely wait staff.  We ordered the whole fried fish and a side order of steamed vegetables.  It was a huge portion and more than adequate for both my husband and me.  The wait staff was so nice and we enjoyed this.  it was our best meal on our vacation.

WEYhLkR0hIC7v7SPiOHwug.text: I just love their dishes and my favorite is the pad see ew. It's just nice place to seat down and eat and the stuff is always so friendly and nice. One of my favorite Thai restaurant.

iostbedy4PQRdaY2yKXUqQ.text: The best Thai food I've had in Vegas. Absolutely delicious. Ambience is soothing, service is on point, food is exceptional.

lLVUB4RpfiUlPSQnIkvJGQ.text: My family and I stumbled upon this place to have our Christmas eve dinner. The food was fantastic and the service was awesome. I highly recommend ordering the Rad Na noodles or the spicy basil fried rice. This place is vegetarian friendly too.

4CWyYVcLMQH9LbARI275Ww.text: When my boyfriend and I found this place on Yelp, he wanted to go because of the reviews. Of course, I said why would I visit Vegas to eat Thai food? However! This place was amazing, I'm glad we went, and they are not joking about their spice levels (so beware!). The coconut juice is amazing and very refreshing. I highly recommend.

m1RMOymviKXRe9uSOXdvEw.text: First time here. Amazing yellow curry.  Loved the Thai iced tea because it was not too sweet and syrupy. Pad see ew (?) was also very good as was the pineapple fried rice. Will define be back. Great service:)!

vgtUz1T-VxeDAR3N6Swx6A.text: Our waitress was so patient to explain so many options on the menu. Try the house tea-it takes like a combination of black tea and horchata and was terrific. Large portions, fresh shrimp and meats and the soups were superb.

_GT-XGbuvXaicf8kPe1JFA.text: Good meal for a good price.  Staff was extremely polite and I liked the spacious interior.

_vS_i0SobEyHvGJjCQA3XA.text: Wow! I am so happy that we have a world class Thai restaurant on this side of town. When I entered I noticed a very clean room with a nice fountain providing  a soothing background. I was greeted with a smiling face and promptly seated.  I had the Thai dumplings and they were scrumptious.  There were 5 in the order and served in a beautiful white oval shaped serving bowl with a lettuce leaf lightly drizzled in a peanut sauce.  For my main course I had the combination red curry ordered at spice level 5.  There was two medium sized shrimp that were sweet and spicy.  The beef and chicken were very well prepared and served in a beautiful serving platter with a bowl of rice.  The curry was very well done with a slight burn on the lips.  I may try spice level 6 next time.  For a drink I had the jasmine tea served in a large clear glass cup which I thought was unique.  I have a lot of favorite Thai restaurants in town and this one ranks near the top of my list.  Bravo!

KoRsk3KzWgGp1amL26-3wg.text: Love the crab rangoon is crispy on the outside and soft and warm on the inside. The food is delicious and it's nice to be able to order delivery through the GRUBHUB app!

lEOIpzusLrfPmo9HAKNk9Q.text: Ordered a Pad Thai with chicken. It had too much oil and the chicken had the consistency of rubber. Would not recommend.

iotiptxGHutUXogMztT6gQ.text: Just after picking up a car at the airport, yelp sent us to the closet Thai place. We were tired and hungry. This place is great . We had Satay Chicken, fresh rolls, curry and cashew chicken.  All very good. Their  spice level is off the charts though. If you usually do 2, do 1.

_TZqH_IDCcgXozrv9sc27A.text: WoW!  Some of the best Thai food ever....  Tom Kha soup is so rich and creamy. Really brought memories of Bangkok back  Also run by the sweetest family.

EIJagnI-QK_YPHTKhjd4AQ.text: Great service and food well above our expectations! Haven't had such good Thai food for a while! The pad thai is very tasty plus the coconut water also adds the extra vibe!

EClstH3Dpo6Q-2BFzKRSKg.text: Fresh and delicious. AND a really nice presentation. Very reasonably priced.  The restaurant is a little sparse, like it's missing some tables.  But we were here at an off hour and there were plenty of people. They've only been here 3 months. Will definitely come back!

wSeTyR6Vu3tNOyBjgxprGw.text: food are great! its a must try! if they are in a better localtion its going to be packed! try it before everyone are going there.

epxAMCroXX9-4-VIJ_5P7A.text: While the food is terrific, their service is slow. I had put a large lunch order in for work and was told it would be ready in 30 minutes. When I arrived to pick up the order, I waited another 30 minutes.

4zIDCVkcBPLGhhSWCM0ulw.text: Some of the best thai I've had in a really long time!! Had panang curry and crab Rangoon....delicious!

AzxlYnuZHkA05QlkklXm3w.text: This is one of my new favorites, they have a nice clean dining room with even better service. They never seem to disappoint with the food, whether I eat there, pick it up, or with delivery.. which I've done all. Delivery was so nice since I didn't want to drive in the wind, and showed up faster then expected. My personal favorite is the chicken pad Thai, with a medium spice..but be warned they don't play when it comes to spice, just like I like it. My boyfriend like the Mongolian beef, plus those potstickers are bomb dignity. We tried the wonton soup since we're not felling then best and it was pretty damn good. Can't wait to try some other things.

saxVWeOZ9nk1-xw-c9TWjQ.text: This is ny favorite thai restaurant i order pork pad thai , green curry , fish cake and milk tea it was so good I can't believe it. Waitress ,location everything it's perfect.

UUd8wswyaxzCV01FW0HduQ.text: Nice lil restaurant. They mixed up the spicy level on 2 of my plates. The spicy basil was great, panang curry was oily but ok and the Tom kha was full of flavor. Overall, I would go back. The 20% off and free Thai coffee are also a convincing factors (1st month open).

J2Y-XuPy1vme1FxNeI_Lag.text: If I could rate this place a 10, it would most definitely be a 10!!! GREAT customer service. Portions were bigger than I expected. If you like Thai iced tea, I recommend this place. I Am Thai Cuisine is my new favorite Thai restaurant!

ctHO4RAq4LokmTvlkXK6cw.text: Another great find in Las Vegas! We had Thai dumplings with sweet black sauce, pineapple fried rice and panang curry and it was all delicious! The service was outstanding! I will come back to this place for sure on our next visit.

UGzwXwprjpC_p7bv_LEjig.text: This is my new Thai place,I loved the food and the service was good,clean restaurant, mom is the chef she is Thai and her cooking was fantastic  She knows how to cook authentic Thai ( especially I was tested her on pad Thai it tastes so original the reason I said that because I had been working with Thai airways for 10 years and I had been in Thailand so many times,so her pad Thai I am proud to tell you it's phenomenal)  I would recommend to all my customers and friend to check this place out.... Thanks mom

RUA9uhNuT2x6bi9OX4U_TA.text: I had Pad Thai and a curry dish and the food was quite good.  Prices were decent also.  For comparison, I ate at Arawan Thai the next evening and the food there wasn't nearly as good as this place, but cost more.

Vn4tt-qh-sT7wyE815f0jw.text: This is by far my favorite Thai restaurant in the Vegas area! The staff here is just as wonderful as the delicious dishes they serve!

Zt_o6Ykx9JKvK6vhjpS1vA.text: Found this place because I was staying near by and what good luck it was. The Shrimp Pad Thai was great. I had it made a spice level 3, and that was plenty for mere mortals. My buddy had the Green Curry and said it was fantastic as well.  It was empty when we walked in, so we were worried. As soon as the food came out, we knew others were just missing out. Do yourself a favor and go check this place out.

nxLa-f9tUj3qYShzL5WE9Q.text: I would give 6 stars if I could! Honestly the best Thai food even close to authentic Thai cuisine from Thailand. Friendly hosts who took care of our every need. I would strongly recommend this to anyone in town.

t3U74jD7f4lEukYiX9wv8w.text: This place was great!! Reasonable prices, good food, and they let you choose your spiciness level on a 10-point scale!

rIm-CWxa3Akp2ocGOxCUvw.text: Amazing dinner. We had our food delivered and it was perfect.  We had Shrimp Tom Yum soup, Thai Beef Salad, Spicy Basil Pork and for dessert Sweet Sticky Rice with Mango.  The flavors complemented each other.  The mango was sweet and the Sticky Rice tasty.  Would love to try dinning in next time.

QmRqblrnmfqXnFyzujSIqw.text: Best Thai place in Vegas! Wonderful food, lovely people that work here. I recommend this place to everyone.

kiKjYFEzuDHvwSHg08BpGw.text: The food here is excellent and the presentation is a work of art!  Simply amazing.  Decor is so so and the AC doesn't always work right.  One nice thing is the tables are not jammed on top of one another so it is a more private dining experience.  Beautiful food!!

EJRue34BwpvsuYNla12E3A.text: I hate to give this place a poor review, but we had a bad experience. We ordered delivery for New Year's Day, we requested most dishes mild and medium spice and 1 dish spicy because this place usually makes things a little more spicy than normal. Fair warning, I love spice! I make everything spicy! But when we got the food, the medium was SPICY and the spicy I couldn't even eat, my mouth was in pain, I had to drink milk and my skin around my lips turned red and splotchy like koolaid mouth! It became a dare to try the red curry and watch people freak out. It was unbearable. I had a bunch of guests and luckily I have 4 bathrooms because every one of them was occupied! Something went wrong, something wasn't good or cooked right or something because everyone got ill!! I thought it was just the spice level, but the next day I ate the last remaining mild dish and within 30 min, I too was in the bathroom again. Not a great New Years celebration.

F9mbs6w2irAmvtytYUkmnA.text: Absolutely fantastic and really close to the outlets! Cucumber salad, Pad tai, wonton soup, curry, and the Thai tea were all amazing. Will come here again when in Vegas!

dBqckNy06x_m_FSshXaC3g.text: This restaurant I MUST say has the BEST & FAST service ever! I wish more restaurants are like this! After doing some retail therapy shopping, I got really hungry and I was long overdue for lunch. I had been craving Thai food for a few days now and it was perfect timing because I Am Thai Cuisine was right down the street from the mall. Tiki (Cute name for cute girl!) was the person who helped me with my to-go order! She was so welcoming when I came into the restaurant with her big smile and upbeat energy.! Then she handed me a menu. I told her I wanted a large size chicken Tom Yum soup that I've ordered before. The only difference is I told her to make it spicier to clear up my sinuses since I'm going through VERY SEVERE allergies right now. I ordered that soup, but I also wanted an entree. I couldn't decide if I wanted chicken fried rice or chicken Pad Se Ew. Tiki highly suggested that I get the Pad Se Ew. Typically I like adding heat to my Thai food, but she said the noodles are good by itself. She offered me a drink and I ordered water since I was so thirsty from all the shopping I did and it was hot outside since it is still summer here in Las Vegas. I wish I could have ordered Thai milk tea, but since I'm on antibiotics, my doctor said I can't have dairy. Therefore I had to settle for water to drink. My order was made quickly and she organized my to go food so neatly! Thank you so much Tiki for your hospitality!

4HL9yPdfXOIg1gsNlTpx3A.text: 'Very Spicy' was actually just that!  Great food & very fast!  Pad Thai was delicious & so was the Garlic Pepper Chicken. Excellent!

Both the owner and our server were extremely attentive to our wants and needs. It was my first time ever eating papaya salad and my first few bites were questionable but I ended up eating it all after I got used to the taste, it was delicious. The plate presentation is so pretty with orchids, banana leaf and butter lettuce helping in each presentation, we just kind of admired our plates before digging in. The restaurant is very spacious and clean. The location is a little inconspicuous with lots of parking and most important thing for me is their water tastes good, not like heavy chlorine. The taste of their dishes coupled with their reasonable prices warrants a definite return visit. Overall a solid five stars.

ilkQ-xXtxOqznfBiW4PwiQ.text: So amazing! The Thai coffee has no bitterness.  For our appetizer we had the Thai beef jerky which was delicious, tough but flavorful.    For our soup we had Tom Kha Kai, which is one of our favorite Thai soups, they didn't disappoint. The Tom Kha Kai was so creamy and the mushrooms fresh with just a hint of lemon grass!  We had two entrees, the panang curry with chicken and chicken spicy basil. The panang sauce  was creamy with large chunks of chicken. The spicy basil was delicious, something different was carrots and green beans which i felt like it made the dish more complete nutritionally. The chicken was minced instead of left as chunks which left a happy texture on the tongue.  I would say amazing all the way around.   The service was super nice and concerned about our experience.   Overall, a very good experience and comparable to our favorite place, lotus of siam. I wish they would add the crispy duck with thai basil sauce like lotus, then this place might be our favorite.

fBowzGmxPgM6JXfESBYtBg.text: The place hits me unlike any other Thai restaurants I've been to. The food tastes great, the presentation was impressive, and the service was awesome.  I had Panang Curry, Tom Yum Soup w/ Shrimp, and beef jerky.  The curry was definitely flavorful, enough spice and sweetness to balance out the salt, goes great with rice. Tom Yum Soup was a little sourer than the ones I've had before, which I found to be surprisingly good.  Beef Jerky was something new and different to me, it was tender, a bit chewy, but not the kind of overcooked meat that only gets bigger in your mouth as you chew. Flavorful by itself, and with the sauce it comes with, even better!  Would definitely come back again just to try out other things.

ooPhDYnwBl3bSpQ6aMgtWw.text: Compared to other thai restaurants that I've been to, this is by far my favorite. The place is very nice despite it being located in quite deserted area. CcCuRjhamN2-jKsCahLQsw.text: Second Update:  just had another amazingly great dinner.  This place rocks.  It is arguably the best Thai food in Las Vegas.  And it has never been crowded any time we have been there.  It is a bit of a drive for us, but well worth the trip.  Update:  We had a wonderful experience.  They turned down the background music (at our request) which improved the ambience greatly.  We were a group of 8 and everyone was delighted with the food.  It is now one of my favorite Thai restaurants in LV.    Here is my original review posted shortly after the restaurant first opened:  We love Thai food and are always looking for new places.  Saw this one on Yelp and gave it a try.  The food was quite excellent.  I had vegetable soup and red curry.  Both were very tasty.  Be forewarned, "medium" really means "spicy."  But really quite delicious.  My wife had Pad See Ewe (sp?) which she liked very much as well.  The service was also very good and the staff is quite friendly.  The prices are also very reasonable.  So, why not 5 stars? The elevator music was driving us nuts. It is pretty annoying.  The restaurant has only been open a few months so my hope is they'll fix it up a bit and maybe find some better music to play.

5kMKyQaTiTIP4AAi1xq8Sg.text: Excellent! Came here because we were in the area and it's the best rated Thai food place on Yelp around here...we were definitely not disappointed.   It's in the corner of an unsuspecting strip mall and it was pretty slow inside (Thursday at 7pm) but that was not at all a testament to the food.  We had the Pad Kee Mao and the Cashew Chicken and both were excellent. Their spicy scale leans more toward spicy so even at a 3 it was a solid medium on the spicy scale, maybe even more spicy than medium so be careful.  The portion sizes for the price were very good and the service was excellent. I didn't love the Thai Iced Tea (just a touch too sweet) but everything else about our experience was perfect.  Will for sure be back.

0rz5r1VV72qVfNAsrn8okg.text: Happened across this restaurant by chance as we needed to grab a bite before our long trip to Vegas. Thank god for Yelp because this place was excellent!  I had the beef pad see ew and an order of their papaya salad. My papaya salad came out first and had the perfect level of heat. Tasted super fresh and had a great crunch. My pad see ew had beautiful char marks on the noodles and was so flavorful. The beef was tender and it was a generous portion for the cost.  Prices are on the lower end which was appreciated after the overpriced food from the Strip. I highly recommend I Am Thai for your Thai cravings!

tuS2hb_QRpUhl2VXp1Z5kg.text: All around, this was a very good Thai Restaurant. Ordered Basil fried rice (very good) ,larb, noodles and Thai beef jerky (a little fatty but seemed purposeful to keep meat juicy. Sauce was amazing.) Will be visiting again. joVt58X9CwcSJkCsLLA5MA.text: I ordered in and it was just okay. I have to say the crab wontons were great. They had discernable pieces of crab in them, which is rare these days. The Thai tea was large and tasty.   However, the pad thai was super bland. They don't do lemon or much veggies. The tamarind sauce had no flavor so I had to add my own lime and peanut to finish it off.

GhU8j9Msza7zDVPm9ONnQw.text: We were staying at Mandalay Bay and wanted Thai food. We saw there was Lemongrass at the Aria, but in all honesty, how I feel about glitz and glam when it comes to ethnic food, I was a bit turned off. I decided we could Uber off the strip to find some authentic cuisine.  When we opened the beautiful heavy doors, the entire restaurant was empty. It was a little after 8:30pm and it closes at 10, last call is at 9:30 and I was a bit scared of the lack of patrons.   We ordered three dishes, a yellow curry with chicken and bamboo shoots, spicy eggplant and fried tofu and pad thai. As I took my first sip of my Thai iced tea, my worries slowly went away. Our entrees arrived and each bite of every dish made me so proud of leaving the comforts of the Strip and explore local spots. All we kept saying to each other was, "OMG, this is delicious." We ended our meal with fried pancake. Bomb dot com.   Service was impeccable and food was ON POINT. Total bill came to 54 dollars, including a 20 percent tip. Vegas. That's a winner.

ybaW2IDnMiBm2Z4UR_hHDw.text: My crew and I had just finished a hike down at the Gold Strike Hot Springs and another group of friends had wrapped up a day of climbing in Red Rock. We were all starving and decided to meet somewhere in the middle. It came down to either Ramen or Thai. We settled on Thai and more specifically on I Am Thai Cuisine (IATC). We were not disappointed.  IATC is pretty easy to find and parking was also easy. We were dropping in on a Sunday evening around 5PM and the place was kind of empty. As a result we were seated pretty much immediately. Server was attentive and friendly.  ProTip: On the time we ate there (12/16/2018) three of us used the Check-In offer for some delicious Thai Ice Tea. DO IT!  We ordered several items and ate them family style. Here's what we ordered and what we thought about it: Yellow Curry with Pork: This was great. The curry was sweet and not too spicy. The pork pieces were tasty and not overcooked. Definitely worth getting if you like curry. Panang Curry with Chicken: This was also delicious, but slightly more spicy than the Yellow curry. The group was kind of split down the middle on which was better. Personally I preferred the Yellow curry because it also had potatoes and carrots while the Panang was more just curry, green onions, and the meat. Both curry dishes came with a bowl of white rice. Crispy Pork with Chinese Broccoli (special request off menu): This was pretty tasty. The pork is fried to a crispy, salty, flavorful piece and tossed in with a leafy kind of veggie. I didn't even know about this, but one of us in the group knew to ask for it. Definitely ask for it. Tom Yum with Chicken: This soup was okay, broth was clear and watery but like many of the dishes it was spicy. Overall I could take it or leave it. Pad See Eiw with Pork: This was pretty good. The was plenty of noodles and ingredients. Can't say it was the best I've ever had, but it was certainly really good. Thai Fried Rice with Beef: This was pretty standard issue. Nothing stand out, but decent. You could probably pass on this unless you just needed a filler dish. Chicken over Fried Rice: The fried rice is identical to the Thai Fried Rice, but layered with a bunch of slices of fried chicken breast. The rice is okay and the chicken wasn't bad. Crispy and tender. Not really flavorful, but they included a sweet sauce. Fried Banana: This wasn't bad, but no need to go out of your way to get it. The bananas were wrapped up in a crepe like shell and deep fried then lightly drizzled in honey and powdered sugar. I also saw the menu had mango with sticky rice and next time I'll look to try that. Thai Ice Tea (Free on Yelp with check-in): Maybe it's me and my taste buds, but this was too sweet for me. I had to pour in some extra ice water to dilute the sugary flavor. Overall it's what you expect, but it tasted extra good after a long hike or day out climbing on the rock.  Yeah so overall I Am Thai Cuisine pleased everyone in the group. Definitely look to hit it up again if we're in the mood for Thai Food. Prices were reasonable and food quantity was fair. It's definitely bookmarked.

zVjkAOFM2sG1aRu32c-I3Q.text: We ate here after a long day at a trade show. We wanted something light and a place with vegetarian options. I'm such a safe person, I ordered the shrimp pad thai. The shrimp were huge!!!! I really liked the sauce and mopped the whole thing. My colleagues had the green curry (she said it was too spicy and she's Indian!), and the other had a catfish dish. Both looked delicious.   This restaurant is a short ride away from the strip, free parking, I think it was in a strip mall shared with a gas station.   Service is fast and ladies working were sweet.

YF2V5zPpTDBVfDFH-5u5YQ.text: Sawadee Kaaaah... (hello in Thai). How do I know this? Because I used to live in Thailand for a year. This means...I know good Thai food when I see it. I Am Thai has everything I've been looking for:  1. A good Pad See Ew. This place has it!  (Pro Tip: If you're only a beginner in Thai cuisine and are scared to try anything but the Pad Thai, this would be a solid beginner's choice that will surprise the hell outta ya).  2. A curry that taste authentic. Another check mark! Their red curry is excellent. A must get.  3. Solid, cheap lunch specials. You get a soup, entree and a spring roll for less than $10? Count me in.   4. Nice, kind-hearted Thai people. Also check.   I love I Am Thai and definitely can say it's pretty close to Bangkok as I can get in Las Vegas. However, the Pad Thai is way too saucy. I'd skip it here. Other than that, go for it!!

PDQX8y2csu31k9QdSjn1kA.text: Food and service great!  Love The pad thai and crab fried rice.  Will go back for sure or order out! Small place prob not good for big gatherings.  Use your yelp check in -I had mines to go!  Will come back just to try other foods.

iBvVVHNw2RxyGaVDGFOB_Q.text: I had such high hopes for this place after the good reviews and the fact that it was close to work.   I went here with a coworker. I was excited there was a lunch menu but bummed it was pretty limited. I was in the mood for seafood, so I ordered a squid salad off the regular menu. I asked for no spicy sauce and the waiter asked me if I wanted the dish spicy (didn't I just say no sauce?). When the entree came it was still covered in sauce (a tad spicy) and the squid was super tough. I could barely eat it but I didn't really feel like sending it back since I was short on time. I should have known better than to order it when it was the only squid entree on the menu.  Coworker got the chicken and broccoli and he described it as tasting like an "expensive TV dinner".    Also they charge .50 for a credit card transaction and they require it be at least $15. Yikes.   Overall I was hoping for a better close-to-work lunch spot, but I left disappointed.
