P-nRloTJ3NOK44ndvZJ1zg.text: To me, this place does not live up to its rating. I've been here twice, months apart and unfortunately it was the same experience,  nothing special.  The only reason we stopped by again? Because we were in the area, looking for Thai and I had bookmarked this place, but forgot we'd already been and remembered as soon as we pulled up, the prior experience. We were too hungry to go somewhere else so we tried it again.  Both times we came after a lunch rush, about 1p. And both times, the restaurant was clearing out, but we had to wait for a table to be cleaned. I can't imagine what it would be like during the actual lunch rush because ALL the tables still had dirty dishes on them for a good  while. And a table only got cleaned when new customers came in. Nobody was manning the front desk this time, so a couple actually walked out tired of waiting to be seated? There were 2 servers/waitresses and 1 cook who kept coming out of the kitchen. I made a comment to our server that they must've been busy, and she said they were short one because they called in sick. Hmm was that the same reason last time too? The tables did eventually get cleared    Now for the food. I don't think this was authentic thai. The flavors of the lime, basil, fish sauce, palm sugar, Thai pepper, basil were not there at all. We've tried the Thai egg rolls, papaya salad, larb,  tofu basil , the basic dishes and I was not a fan, there are far better Thai restaurants around, sadly this isn't one of them.  Extra star for effort on our server who was very pleasant.

PnPabJ0JqKbIPfIE_EFIaw.text: Food was Excellent, the ambience needs a lot of work.  Highly recommended the spicy catfish and spicy eggplant with shrimp. I've tried a lot of Thai food in Vegas and this is my favorite so far.  The ambience leave a lot to be desired but the food was amazing!

aw_6aoSz4e6uoK_8H3fT6A.text: My family and I got dinner here yesterday after searching through Yelp, and this restaurant exceeded all of our expectations. We ordered:  *Thai Dumplings *Beef Larb *Roasted Duck Red Curry *Tom Yum (Chicken) *Fried Fish with Green Apple Salad *Mango Sticky Rice   The standouts were the tom yum, the red curry, and the mango sticky rice, but everything was so yummy. The tom yum especially was probably the best I've ever had. The three of us ate until we were stuffed and left with 2 to go containers of leftovers.   The staff in particular were so friendly and kind - we ordered fresh coconut juice and at the end they offered to cut open the coconut so we could get the meat inside. We were only in Vegas for the weekend but I am already planning to come back here the next time we visit.

iWj7fon7xq9CDJvJ0pYrdw.text: The only thing decent about this place is the price. We got a couple of curries and a noodle dish. In retrospect, shouldn't have even bothered trying to decide between the yellow and the massaman when both curries that we ended up getting turned out so bland and cloyingly sweet. The noodle was okay but very greasy. Rice to go with the curry was stale and and not jasmine rice. How did they get such a high rating?

jloVAknjhemDcEgR4RIsyw.text: This place is sooo good. I've only been here once and I can't wait to go back. V3-x7aOS_rDkfPm5u5AbcQ.text: We discovered these fine folks after a recent stop at the south outlets. They've only been open for a couple months, so I hope you can show them some love. Hzija_tYE9hzAFHyCoOi9w.text: So I found myself here because my normal Thai place was closed on Christmas (lucky Thai on Silverado Ranch) and since I am alone on Christmas I am going to indulge in my favorite foods no matter what: extra spicy drunken noodle, crab Rangoon, Thai tea, and mango sticky rice. :) what's better than that? So here I am, my scary movie selected from red box, my bottle of red wine, and my Thai food in its signature and ever so elegant stryofoam box... ready for my evening of selfishness and excess!   They say they are spicier than most places and they are right! Normally I get a 7 and it isn't spicy enough but this time at I Am Thai it is perfect. I love when things work out and when employees are honest (with a white girl no less) about spice level. They didn't look at me and say "7 is too spicy. Well give you a 4" Which has happened to me SO many times. Here, they were honest AND they gave me what I wanted.   So if you find yourself alone on Christmas, or just hungry for noodles and curry, head on down to I Am Thai. It is worth the trip for sure!

O-RSELW8wus3YChuSQVRjw.text: This place was a charming spot located near the airport. We were glad to find this place on our way to the airport. Comparing with the average prices in Las Vegas in general, their pricing is very affordable while they still keep up with the food quality.   We enjoyed everything we ordered during our visit: Pad Kee Mao Noodles ($9.95), Thai Fried Rice ($9.95), Coconut Ice Cream ($5.95), and Thai Iced Tea ($2.95). The food was very well seasoned. The portions of the food were generous enough to satisfy our hungry stomach. Their Coconut Ice Cream was soooo good. It had a homemade icy texture with a good flavor of real coconut instead of the artificial powder flavor thing.   The place was spacious, a little old, but clean and well kept. There were only 2 parties including us so we had a good experience with our service quality. Highly recommend this one for their budget friendly quality!

smHXNHRDBEwRaUFsrvw9eA.text: I really enjoy the lunch special. I had gone about 5 times since it's close to work and you just can't beat a lunch deal under $10.   But last time I took my husband and we both had the runs for days. Horrible pain and was definitely food poisoning.   I'm only giving the three stars because it was good before I got food poisoning, but I won't be back.

pvzk_CoyQe0HE6hpCuw5Gw.text: Awesome service, fast delivery, delicious customized thai if you want it. As always, the best places are tucked away, off the main streets, where the locals know to go.   I am Thai is excellent food.  The best part is somehow they always remember your name and what you prefer, even if you have not appeared in a long time, they make you feel important, and I think that carries all the way into the kitchen. If you happen to be down by the Airport area around Warm Springs, and Bermuda... they are tucked behind the GreenValley grocery / gas station. Dont let the location fool you..  the rent is cheap, so their prices are cheaper.. but the food rates super high.. and they deserve kudos.

vVPTf-UFDrDF8SIlz9hELQ.text: One of the few Thai restaurants in Las Vegas. Called about 20 minutes beforehand and was able to get a reservation for our big group. The food was not bad. Pineapple fried rice was okay. Could be better. Tasted very interesting than normal. The Pad See Ew was good. Noodles were soft. The papaya salad was decent and spicy. Other items were pretty good too. Their mango sticky rice and coconut ice cream was delicious! Service was super friendly and attentive.   AS ALWAYS, NOM FOR LIFE!

egP_a7b7FitBAkEcnxb9Ig.text: Was in Las Vegas for work and was looking for a local place to get dinner.  Found this place on yelp, and the reviews were dead on.  I am glad we had dinner here. Good service and food, super reasonable prices.  We had a curry and pad see ew, both were delicious. Our server warned us that their spice scale is a bit high - a 3 there is like a 5 at most other places, so keep that in mind if you don't like the heat.  They have an extensive menu with lots of options. I would definitely eat here again if I find myself in the area.

kbHFFjAWv8ala8QnsWz4XA.text: A solid Thai restaurant.  Came in with coworkers for lunch.  The inside of the restaurant is bigger on the inside than I thought.  Tables are spaced out nicely so you don't feel crowded at all.  The first thing you notice when you walk in is their specials menu, which I do appreciate.  Ordered fish cake and Thai dumpling appetizers.  The fish cakes were good.  I don't see this on the menu at very many places, but I was happy to try them and I was not disappointed.  It is an appetizer worth trying.  The Thai dumplings are made with chicken and mushroom, different from the ones you'd find at other places that are pork or pork and shrimp filled.  The ground chicken gives it quite a different texture and obviously a different taste.  My coworker said these are the best sui mai style dumplings he's had in Vegas.  Although I am not as enthusiastic as he is about these dumplings, I did think they were good and definitely worth a try.  For the main event, I ordered spicy basil with beef lunch special.  This is kind of my standard go-to item at Thai places.  I ordered it 10 spicy and it was just right.  In my book, I'd rate it about a 7 spicy.  The meal was delicious, it was on par with other spicy basil dishes around town.  The lunch special also came with salad and an egg roll, pretty standard fare, nothing to write home about.  All in all, an enjoyable lunch.  The service was great, staff was very friendly.  They were very accommodating when it came to splitting the check 4 ways.    If you're in the neighborhood, stop by and give them a try.  You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai dumplings

4feRR3x9me0w44ZpWNYcuQ.text: This restaurant is randomly located but I am glad I tried it out. The food was decently priced despite the super large and nice interior. It almost looked like a fancy restaurant inside.   All the dishes were good and I'm surprised why this place ain't nor popular: inside is super spacious so it looks like there aren't any customers. Service was 5 stars.  Crab fried rice-5 stars  Pork pad Thai- 5 stars  Papaya salad- 4 stars

Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Papaya salad

PZeKQCRFta2qVbWVE-vq1Q.text: Say it loud and proud, I Am Thai Cuisine -- With such a declarative name, you're serving 'em looks and backing it up.   We usually come in for their lunch specials which are super affordable at around $8-10. This includes your choice of the soup of the day or salad, egg roll, and choice of one of ten entrees. My go-to here is the SPICY BASIL. I've had it made with beef and also chicken. Both are solid. If you check into Yelp, your green Thai iced tea is on the house. (The server usually has to ask someone if it can be redeemed with lunch specials and they typically honor it.)   Lunchtime is bustling with business people, but dinnertime might be a different story. There's plenty of seating, suitable decor. A lot of empty space because of the sprawling layout. Maybe this used to be a bar, dance hall, birkenstock sweat shop? Who knows, but one thing's for sure -- we'll be returning.

vtJPCI8TAk1NqIoZL4D07Q.text: One cold and dreary and did I say cold day, I was in desperate need of hot soup for lunch to warm me up from a cold office and then stepping into the cold weather outside.   After searching on Yelp on what was nearby, I tried this little place tucked away in small complex and went for their chicken noodle soup. The restaurant was clean and had nice decor.   The broth was nicely flavored and it was perfectly piping hot and warmed me right up inside like Olaf getting a warm hug!   The girls working that day were very nice and quick on their feet with service. Pricing for the soup was reasonable, but I did think it was a little ridiculous they charged an extra dollar when I requested extra cilantro.   I'd come back and actually try a Thai dish like pad thai or pad see ew.

JsGA6vW7VDOk-RgffApcDA.text: Good quality authentic Thai food. Lunch special was $9.63 total for a cup of egg drop soup, a spring roll with sweet chili sauce for dipping and pad Thai with chicken spicy 8 and a water to drink. They have about 10 options for the lunch special price of $7.95 including chicken, pork, beef, tofu or vegetable. $9.95 for a shrimp dish and you can substitute brown rice for $1.00 more. If you spend less than $10 you will have a $0.50 fee for using a credit card.  Nice open restaurant, kind of busy for lunch so if you ask for anything make sure you chase down a server.   Yes, I will return and try other lunch specials to see how the menu is overall. Everyone in our lunch group of four enjoyed their meal and had been here numerous times.   It was my first visit and really have nothing to complain about except that the Yelp check in offer for a free Thai tea was not available for lunch, they said it was only good for dinner (though there is no fine print stating such).  Overall good portion size and spicy flavorful pad Thai.

DvYF-ody7jBffMHqwxeV2A.text: I am not from Vegas and didn't feel like leaving my hotel. I am a HUGE fan of curry. I decided to try this place. Their delivery was as stated online, about 45 minutes, but it came straight to my hotel door and was quick and easy. I also really enjoy non-fried spring rolls and this is where I felt they could have done better. The rolls were huge but basically just stuffed with lettuce. There were 2 shrimp in each roll (but placed towards the ends) thus the middle section was just lettuce. I only had one bite that had any cilantro so it had little flavor. The mass curry was good, although loaded with onions and had an expected amount of pork (you can choose which protein you want them to use - which is cool). I ordered it medium spicy and I was pleasantly surprised that it actually had a kick to it. If you are not a fan of spice then I would definitely order mild.

u3JKDjYtL_U_8uVDeqBIpg.text: The food was delicious.  I ordered the Lunch Chicken Pad Thai.   I ordered it online and they had it ready when promised.  I walked 10 minutes back to work and the food was still hot!

x3Bp0zgEZiQPchCMT84D-Q.text: When it comes to Asian restaurants I am very skeptical about the service, but especially hygiene.. I read about their impressive reviews on the internet and decided to dine here. I have to admit that this Thai restaurant by far the cleanest, tidiest  place ever been. I actually looked through the transparent kitchen doors and saw that this Asian restaurant takes hygiene standards serious.  The waitresses were all Thai and very polite and smiling the whole time we were there..  I loved their curry sauce dish along with shrimp tom yum soup that was yummy..   Don't forget to order fresh coconut, it rescued my tong  like a firefighter from spicy Thai food which I love.   If you like Thai food and concern about hygiene, you can trust I am Thai. You won't disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I am in love with this place

h_2L2hZd8YRAKmXepe7wrA.text: The search for good Thai ends here!   Wow and yummmm....   spice is HOT!  I ordered to go and the lady told me to spice down (I usually order a 7), so I ordered spice 5 ( I need to go down one more....  ).    I had the spicy eggplant, cashew chicken, Tom yum soup, and crab ragoons.   I loved the egg plant and soup, my hubs loved the cashew chicken and crab ragoons!  Happy wife, happy husband,  happy life!

p7bywPpeaWGXnwScRfssLw.text: I went on a Thursday after work and it was great! They give good sized portions for a reasonable price. We had the Thai bbq chicken and the yellow curry. Beware of the spicy levels because they make it hot. I got a 6 on s scale of 1-10 and my mouth was on fire considering I usually get an 8 at others places. Staff was nice and the place was pretty quiet. I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HEb4HymwP7Zy080lrlVEGA.text: Food is delicious always on point and they really make their stuff HOT. I'm a huge fan of spicy food but they let you know a number 3 is actually like a number 10 no exaggeration. Mango sticky rice is also the best I've tried! The reason I knocked off one star is because it's so overpriced I've been to other Thai places and they aren't as pricey.

Uec_xAEueQHUh8b9jUA7bw.text: I love this place! Hands down, the best Thai restaurant we've eaten at in Las Vegas. There spice levels are correct. There Spice level 8 is exactly what you think it should be. Not like most places where a 10 taste like a 4.   I have literally never had a bad meal here. Papaya salad - delicious, pad thai - the right balance, not to sweet or saucy just right, pad see ew - simple great, spicy bail chicken is ridiculously good, tom yum fried rice is one of those special dishes that you have to really question if fried rice can really be so good..   This is a small business and there foods is exceptionally great, the service is above and beyond. And there prices are well below this level of food quality.

87cOnyfRhfCAYjD5vwEtZg.text: Good value. Clean restaurant and very friendly waitress had our toddler smiling.  The soup was good and yellow curry was well executed but quite spicy.  Loved the sticky rice ice cream and peanut dessert.  We will be back!

42IcIKa_H_UvfWhswypwyw.text: Great inexpensive food with great customer service! Cozy atmosphere and very clean. I will be a regular.

pun6IyEPkoWNCMwh7bOdkA.text: I've probably tried around 40 Thai places around LA and Las Vegas combined. This place I stumbled on by accident because I got out of a meeting and wanted some Thai food and searched for it and I'm so glad I did. This is the best Thai food I have ever tried. I use to love another place in Chinatown but ever since I found this place I am a fan. I don't usually write reviews unless I have an AMAZING experience or a Terrible one. This definitely fits the first option. Check this place out if you even like Thai food a little bit. I can definitely say you'll come out loving it.

f53l5AOndpn1cjasd3IuSg.text: I'am new to Vegas from, San Francisco....this is the second Thai Resturant I've been too here,... It's gonna be my to go spot! Great food, amazing, and, friendly stuff.

iPufWwfHzjs48mAhZMedAw.text: This place is AMAZING! Went here due to the high ratings on Yelp. It's located in a strip mall type setting that looks a little sketch from the outside but when you walk they the doors it's very clean and pleasant. Our waitress, Alec was a great pleasure and answered all of our questions to the best of her ability. We indulged on the Appetizer sampler that had the steamed dumplings, crab ragoons, chicken satay and egg rolls each with their own dipping sauce. It was very good. They also had a special of a fried soft shell crab as an appetizer. It arrived with a siracha dipping sauce with spicy mayo and more siracha, oh my goodness it was great! My aunt got the coconut soup with shrimp and that was good, and I got the massaman curry with seared scallops at a 6 level. It was HOT but delicious. We both decided to get the coconut ice cream. Oh my, it was delightful.  It had chucks of coconut and some palm fruit in it, and it arrived in a coconut! Seriously, the entire meal and experience was one of the best I've had in Vegas so far! You will NOT be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The coconut ice cream! Had fresh blue berries and palm fruit as well!

JrVyupzyKxjlHbM1L-GAsg.text: Visiting we Yelped to find a some good Thai food, yelp showed 5 stars.  We figured it was a new place and gave it a shot.  The restaurant is in a small strip mall, plenty of parking.  Nicely decorated, soft instrumental music playing, Fountain bubbling.  We had great service and food was fabulous.  Large menu and you get to pick spice level.  I asked for a 5 which server told me it would be a 3 on their level.  She was so right, it was the perfect heat level.  The 3 of use loved our food and had plenty for lunch the next day.  Recommend you get the appetizer combo, pineapple rice, cashew chicken (not the name, but main ingredients).   I will be back on my next visit to LV.  We mentioned yelp when we got the check and they offered to make one of their appetizers to go with our doggy bags ..nice   reasonably priced.   Give this place a try.

VmmVwhPm9OioPW6i7ZkZig.text: I'm here for the long weekend and would Highly recommend this place. The food is very good. The service is good. The restaurant is clean, the ambience is nice. I had the red curry with chicken, very flavorful. Appetizer was beef jerky, the flavor was good. My boyfriend had the pad kee Mao with chicken, very good. I would definitely come here again.

I3oWMDt7FFICTUgXwdhmRg.text: This is one of my new favorites, they have a nice clean dining room with even better service. They never seem to disappoint with the food, whether I eat there, pick it up, or with delivery.. which I've done all. Delivery was so nice since I didn't want to drive in the wind, and showed up faster then expected. My personal favorite is the chicken pad Thai, with a medium spice..but be warned they don't play when it comes to spice, just like I like it. My boyfriend like the Mongolian beef, plus those potstickers are bomb dignity. We tried the wonton soup since we're not feeling the best and it was pretty damn good. Can't wait to try some other things.

WClvOzp6J93S9DdRfZltxQ.text: Great food and great service. The food was probably 4 stars, but the friendly service gave it an additional star. I got Massaman curry with an 8 spice level. The server asked if I was sure, which made me want the 8 even more. It was quite spicy, but she offered me a chili sauce that they said was their specialty. It was good and she followed up with me. It was my wife's first time having curry and she enjoyed her 0 spice yellow curry as well.

QXFmV52VP3vAXN1b4Rn5sA.text: We ordered carry out for dinner tonight. Everything was hot and delicious. We got chow mein and fried rice with fried chicken for the kids (so no spice) and both were season great and the kids loved them. The spicy basil dish was by far my favorite. We ordered it spicy and it did not disappoint! Everyone had to get an extra glass of water. We will definitely be ordering here again.

U06pm6tdIlBRJMWC_JbOgg.text: Decided to try this place when we were in the neighborhood. We were pleasantly surprised by how good it was. Staff were super friendly and helpful, gave us really good recommendations. My husband ordered tom yum soup with shrimp it was a good balance of sweet and spicy. I had the wonton soup which was delicious with lots of wonton and chicken. We then had garlic pepper beef which had a very powerful garlic flavor and it was delicious and chicken pad Thai which again was really good. Great value for money and we'll definitely make it a regular stop when we're on this side of town! Thanks!

bFZa40WCIV0VciF9eF-B7Q.text: wow! want expecting much for delivery, but man this place is good! pad thai was amazing and the appetizer sampler was so good. might have to order daily while i'm here in Vegas for the week!

1G9vKuQPFx2UxKYJjM2nXg.text: I am Thai is a phenomenal Thai restaurant, especially for lunch. I've been to dozens of different Thai restaurants in my home state, and this one really blew me, and my family away.  The location is great, it's a bit off the strip but still fairly close, especially by car. The service is excellent, our server was very friendly and very helpful. We received a tray of red pepper sauce, hot oil, and various other spices without even asking. (My family loves hot food.) The food was excellent, I ordered the Pineapple Curry, a dish I've been disappointed with at numerous other restaurants. Here at I am Thai however, it was perfect. There was more than enough pineapple, and the sauce was absolutely delicious. Portion sizes were perfect for lunch, and were given a copious amount of sticky rice for all of us. The sticky rice was served fresh and hot. The egg rolls were the best I personally have ever had. Overall, me and my family definitely enjoyed our stay. We've all been to many Thai restaurants, but I honestly believe this may be the best I have ever visited. If I lived in the area, I would come here everyday!

-fkj34Fxvg0xzPXY-f-fTQ.text: Better than Archies.. did I say that?? Holy Thai food Batman! This place was amazing and completely off the hook! Service , food, and drink was amazing ! 5UXTlPf1bZr2DXGCclV9_g.text: Amazing flavors!  Ordered :   Papaya salad with sticky rice and BBQ chicken. Could have used more salad, but it's hard to find a place that gives hefty portions. Chicken was a bit stiff but the sauce on it was great ! Sticky rice was amazing ! Would def get more sticky rice.   Green curry with pork. Ordered level 7 Spice. They have 1-10 spice. Very spicy ! Loved it. They warned us it's spicier here than other Thai food. Be careful what spice # you order. :)  Would def go again to try other. Dishes.   Def a place to take a date on since it has atmosphere and it's very clean. Restaurant dine In prices. There are cheaper places to order to-go around town though.

2VOttU-Tk4akVYt-rnrmjQ.text: We came in the other night 30 minutes before closing.  As we were walking in the only other table seated was leaving.  Instead of begrudging us for coming in so late, we were given a very warm welcome.   You could say the reason we got such great service was because we were the only patrons but I don't believe that to be True.   You could tell the servers were kind and caring.   They answered all questions with patience, they never once made us feel rushed and they made sure our drinks were full.   On top of that I would say that this is one of the best Thai restaurants I've been to in a while when judging price to taste.   The food was fresh (I always judge the shrimp! ) and very flavorful.   And the value was spot on.   We spent less than $40 on 4 very filling dishes.   We'll definitely be coming back!

Se-kS80bMyHf7h7if0butw.text: We ordered in on Father's Day. We received fast service and delivery and the food was excellent.

WlH66sgam8Vmoak0l3Rn2Q.text: We found "I am Thai" a few nights ago as our family drove around starving and browsing Yelp - and I must say, this is probably my new favorite Thai spot in the valley! And, seing as I worked in a Thai restaurant where everything was prepared authentically by a 70 year old Thai woman - it's pretty hard to impress me.   The service was the first thing that stood out. All the waitresses were very attentive, had a great sense of humor, and never left a dirty dish nor empty glass on the table the entire time we dined.   The food was amazing. We had the beef jerky and papaya salad for starters. Then we had entrees. I had shrimp red curry, my husband had Thai style BBQ, and my daughters had shrimp tempura, vegetarian red curry, and shrimp fried rice. We hadn't eaten all day, so this was the perfect amount of food for all of us with a little bit of leftovers. I was greatly imprssed overall, but I have to say that the red curry typically makes or breaks my love for a Thai restaurant, and it was nothing short of perfection here. Yay!   Another bonus, the check was written in Thai. When we asked why, we were told it was so all the cooks could understand the orders (as they didn't read English). It's no wonder everything was amazing, it was authentically prepared. We look forward to coming back again very soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai BBQ Chicken
Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rad Na
Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tempura

1KyrPJcvHbGmcW0alUKhEQ.text: My family stopped by this amazing restaurant when we were travelling. It was on Monday so it was not busy. The staff is very friendly, and the service is quick. We ordered pad thai, curry, Thai seafood spaghetti, crab fried rice and other stuff. All were delicious, specifically Thai seafood spaghetti and pad thai.

OOZwx3_4u1px6io-8znb1w.text: This place was a great find! We came here for lunch. First all I do have to mention that the service was sloooooowwww probably because it was lunchtime but damn it was slow as hell.  If you check in, you get a free coke! No refills on Thai tea or Thai coffee.  The calamari was great presentation. There weren't a lot for something that was $7. It seemed to be over fried. It was okay. I wouldn't get it as the appetizer though.  So if you get the lunch special, it comes with soup and egg roll. It says it comes with salad but we never got it.  We got the pad Thai. It was good. I really liked it. It was the right amount of flavors and wasn't overpowering like other pad thais I've had. It's good with chicken.  The papaya salad was okay. It seemed to be missing something.   The Thai sweet and sour is something I would not recommend. It doesn't taste good. It's more sour than it is sweet. I don't know if it was the pork or something else but it tasted funky.  The red curry was amazing. I really enjoyed it! If you get it with a 4 spiciness, it is enough for someone that doesnt like too much spice but good enough for someone who loves spice. The ingredients worked well together and it was the right amount.   We had spicy basil. It was good. It wasn't the best I have to admit but it was good. There wasn't a lot of basil flavor and I think that's what made it just good.   I would definitely recommend this place.

b2tEBuBDsIfLA505wopcLw.text: The food was great.  I ate here twice earlier this week.  The first night I had Thai Dumplings for an app which was excellent with the accompanying sauce.  My entree was a special non-menu item called Crispy Pork with Chinese Broccoli.  This was the best Thai dish I've eaten anywhere.  Apparently this is a frequent special because another reviewer mentions it, along with accompanying photo.  The next night I had the more conventional pot stickers and chicken panang curry.  Both were great.    I'll definitely return next time I'm in Vegas.

IazjmNUpPENX6Q7NnzXPXg.text: Very disappointing take out experience. We ordered via the yelp app and I drove to pick up the food out of our neighborhood because of the great yelp reviews.  Arrived 15 minutes after placing order. After checking in with the hostess/server, she said the food was almost ready and to have a seat. I was surprised that the food wasn't ready because I didn't order anything that typically takes a long time to prepare. Another 10 minutes of waiting and I received our food. There was only one table in the restaurant so I think they didn't start the order until I arrived.   It was empty but the dining room looked clean and nice, I thought if the food is good, we'll come back and dine in.   The food was very disappointing as well.  I'm a larb connoisseur, I order it at every Thai place we try. Unfortunately this was one of the worst ones I've had. It was way too sweet and did not have enough lime or citrus to make it a little sour and tangy the way it's normally prepared. The cabbage pieces were cut so thinly that you can't use them as a lettuce wrap but the pieces were too big for one bite. Awkward size. The larb was also prepared warm and I prefer cold or room temp but that's just my personal preference.   The steamed veggies were fine.  The basil fried rice with beef was also fine. The beef was tender and tasty. The green beans were crisp but the rice was over cooked and mushy.   The pad kee mao was forgettable and the noodles were overcooked.  Sad to say we won't be returning or ordering again.

3gYIrsaZM7nn3M3-4u36Hw.text: Authentic and Delicious!  Looking for good Thai restaurant? Search no more... this is a place to check out! Located at the intersection of Warm Springs and Placid. A short drive from the South Premium Outlet Mall (shopping makes me hungry!).   Been here thrice with my family and we always get the crab fried rice - they are generous with the crab meat! My wife loves it!   Other faves: Thai Dumplings, Combo Appetizer, and Beef Jerky.   Everything was delicious! Service is enthusiastic and friendly. Can't wait to bring our friends here.

LiwgTGjFLuhKupdgff7A1Q.text: Very tender duck - orders the duck in curry. Great dumplings - also very tender, great tase too. Amazed at the quality and friendly staff.

Xx3MV1zQ4BeAQXmpMzjvzA.text: Great service by Tara!  Highly recommend the Thai dumplings, pad Thai, mango sticky rice.  Beautiful presentation of food.

hE_gdtya-xnbpJ-gV1PPEw.text: I came here with family for dinner the day after Christmas. There weren't many other people in the restaurant but I'm guessing it's because it was so close to the holidays. For appetizers, we got the egg rolls and fried tofu. Both were really good and the presentation looked fancy. For my entree, I got the Spicy Eggplant and I chose a spice level of 3 since they said that's like an American 5. However, I didn't find it very spicy at all. In my opinion, it was closer to mild than actually spicy. They do give some chili sauce at the table though so I was able to add that. Next time, I'll request a higher number.   While the food was delicious (I ate the entire thing), the service was spotty. For some reason, we had two waitresses and when everyone got their food, my uncle was still waiting for his. We were already about a quarter of the way through our meal when he still hadn't gotten his order. One of the other waitresses (who hadn't brought us our food) came by to ask how everything was and we told her my uncle hadn't received his order. She looked confused like she had no idea that this had even happened. She went back to the kitchen and about 2 minutes later returned with his dish. I'm not sure if someone forgot about it or if the other girl forgot to bring it out but it wasn't the greatest experience for us since we had come for a family dinner and only one person was left without his meal through the majority of it.   Despite that, if you're looking for delicious Thai food in the area, this is a great place to go. All of us really enjoyed our meal and I would come back here. I just might come with fewer people so that the orders don't get too confusing for them.

hNpCyfFNTKSInkinm4_-sA.text: We stopped in for a late lunch on a Monday afternoon. The restaurant was pretty empty around 1:45pm.  We ordered the shrimp rolls, two lunch specials and a coconut mango sticky rice for dessert.  Each lunch special comes with a soup (egg drop) or salad, along with rice and egg roll. Each special was $7.95. $1 more for shrimp. You are asked how spicy you would like your dish, on a scale from 1 to 10. I got 3 and my boyfriend got 5. He was sweating while he ate his red curry.  The food was good. The shrimp rolls were not over cooked or chewy. They came with a sweet chili sauce. Both lunch specials were about the size you'd expect, not too much but just enough. A great deal for under $10.  I wish they had served a Thai soup instead of eggs drop.  A note.. I did not see their health score posted. Perhaps I didn't look hard enough.  The food was good but it's nothing that I would go out of my way for.

I7eAUat2XufPOidlPWStRw.text: Nice low key place off from the strip. Don't be put off by the location. The food and drinks were delicious. The waitress will explain the menu and advise selecting your level of spicy before ordering. I ordered a variety of appetizers: shrimp rolls, soup, pad Thai and coconut drink. All were awesome. Would definitely recommend to others and come here again when in town.

Sleau-axqbCU2f4NuJgQoQ.text: We had various dishes including Pad Thai, mango salad with BBQ chicken and sticky rice, mussaman curry, and seafood special. Everything was very tasty and seasoned to our individual pallets. We will all return there to eat again before we go home.

1RPHx-Dja6L2p5SYVXGO_Q.text: I only have this business 3 stars because they are not friendly to black folks. The food was Good nonetheless.

nw_NEFDOwjt3kZj5jBbGRg.text: The best Thai food I've had! I Love Thai food but this place just made it that much better! Must try!

FDTRM2gR8u-ywvLKkVvfwQ.text: Great food with casual ambience. Food was fast and delicious. My girls loved the beef broccoli and wife loved the curry (massaman). I enjoyed eating my bbq thai chicken and the crab fried rice was excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummmy

qm4C63WBGpN_uXoVMt9Rdw.text: You must order the Pad Thai I Am. Best pad thai in town with great service. Everything is delicious with amazing presentation everytime I come.

mgUzxMoB3ghVBNB2M23P_g.text: Quick, easy and great for on the go. Got a lot of food but weird because these for some reason my gf wanted chicken wings and that was the best dish. Not bad place to be.

J-aFGvX7QibI0-d_Z6bcBQ.text: Landed in Vegas and headed to this restaurant.. Just wow ...Best Thai place ever ... loved everything we ordered.. fresh rolls, Tom khar soup (to die for this one) and the pineapple fried rice (the fried rice was served within a pineapple..it was pretty cool and tasted yummy as well)

-swAA2piQCm5_xV8DzZWDw.text: Off the bat, the food was great!!! We ordered broccorri, fresh rolls, pad see something, and fried rice with shrimp (skimpy on the shrimp).  Parking was available as it is located in a small shopping center. It also helped that we went an hour before closing.  THE SERVICE: 2.5 stars. Tara who appeared to be the greeter was kind and welcoming. We were a large group of 15 so I know it wasn't easy to take orders from four families, however when we called before hand, they said they could accommodate our large party. The waitress who took our offer was by far RUDE!!! Was in a rush to take everyone's order, skipped over guest who weren't which enough to order, and at some point she dropped her order slips and had the audacity to  literally SNATCH them out from a family member's hand who was courteous enough to help pick them up. Her attitude didn't change until I mentioned OUT LOUD that she was being RUDE.    It's sad, but service makes for half the dining experience and this place did not meet up to the courteous customer service expectations that a paying patron hopes for. Lucky for me, I was in great company with good food, which made the experience a lot more pleasurable.

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

C2KUADAtxrDzfMjJycwoXg.text: Great food! Very authentic and the staff was very friendly and attentive . I'm glad we found this place it will be our new spot when we visit Las Vegas

ieLIjQYuzO9Nv9FT5ds0JQ.text: Quite possibly one of my favorite Thai places in town. The staff remember you if you frequent. Food is always great. Their crab fried rice is top notch. Tom Yum always tastes fresh. Can't ever go wrong. Always love coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mother&#39; Day!!!

DDguZX1drrELFpKahrrPDw.text: Love their food.  Whenever I'm in Las Vegas this is a definite stop. The food is awesome.

GB_gg5rnS310s7kDa5rX6g.text: Stopped in for dinner and loved the food!  We started with egg rolls and dumplings and moved on to the seafood salad and pad king sod (with ginger).  It was all delicious and served with a great presentation.  The staff was was very friendly and attentive.  We would be back every week if we lived in the area.  If you're looking for great Thai food make sure to stop into this hidden gem.

7ITVDZSQ6LSZQtzWrfOyZA.text: We were looking for a hole-in-the-wall and while it doesn't quite fit that description, it is pretty unassuming for the greatness it's packing. I found it here on yelp and if I was just driving by, I would probably miss it. The atmosphere was amazing, from the decoration to the tunes, and the food was phenomenal. My friend and I ordered completely different items and loved them all. The customer service was incredible as they were attentive but not hovering and were extremely kind. I definitely recommend and would eat there again.

-jirXONESjPCccK6SYqG_Q.text: Food portion is good for their price.  Great service, however, we were going to be charged for having a baby counted as the 6th guest in the party, thus, was asked to pay 18% gratuity tip due to the baby being counted as part of the party of six.  Manager , however, was consulted and gratuity fee was waved. Thanks.

AQBsaggVISrdXyADmUdbyg.text: A Yelp search for kabobs led us to the place next door, but when we saw it was actually a pizza place we decided to try I Am Thai instead. I'm so glad we did!!  Although it looks like nothing from the outside, situated as it is in a semi-deserted strip mall sharing a parking lot with a Shell station, everything changes once you walk in the front door. It's appointment is lovely and inviting. Our server, in addition to being friendly and gracious, was exceedingly wise when she cautioned me that I might select to order my entree a little less spicy.   We started with the Fresh Rolls---vegetables wrapped in rice paper. We dipped them in the accompanying sauce which was so delicious we continued to dip the spoon in it after the rolls were gone.   I had Tom Yum soup as my main. It was tangy and rich and delicious. I was exceedingly relieved at our server's earlier caution about the spicyness. And when my eyes started watering and my face turned red she returned with paper napkins and an offer of cucumber salad or milk.   My husband's Larb was equally good. He ate it all in a wink (also taking advantage of the paper napkins).    What a fortunate mis-navigation!  We will definitely be back!

WRD_TEZ-7SVJ1kl0DSUe3Q.text: A nice restaurant located in a strip mall. We had the pad Thai and flat noodles with pork. Everything was very tasty and the service was fast and super friendly.

r989rsEj_WTeIyC9jC4ILg.text: I have only gotten take out at I Am Thai and I have never really sat down and dined there. It's really close to work so whenever I am craving some Thai food for lunch, I would order it from here.   I've gotten to try their pad kee mao aka drunken noodles, red curry, basil fried rice, pineapple curry, pad thai, etc. Everything was always pretty good.  Their pad kee mao is inconsistent though. Sometimes, it's great. Other times, it's overcooked and a little burnt. Their basil fried rice is delicious but their rice is a little mushy. I kind of wished their rice was more firm. But the flavors are fantastic. I love their pineapple curry! It has great flavors to it.   Their spice levels aren't something to joke about. If you can't eat spicy then beware. I've gotten a 10 before and it wasn't too bad. However, their levels are a little different when you order on yelp. I've ordered a "spicy" on Yelp and it was reallly spicy. I loved it but if you'd have to be able to take a 10 to take that. Their medium is perfect. It still has kick but it doesn't kill you.   Also, huge portions.

enbdWIF4rEwvFL9wOSUCbg.text: As far as Thai goes it was pretty good. The service was excellent the only issue; it took way too long.  I ordered from the lunch menu as I'm here during my lunch break typically I expect longer than normal service time as I arrived at Noon. What I didn't expect was getting served an hour later at 1:10pm. I got my lunch plate before I got my soup. I understand the lunch hour is busy but if I'm ordering from the lunch menu I would assume it would be ready to go rather fast or at least faster than other items in the menu.   The food was excellent it tasted great I ordered the spicy basil lunch plate. I ordered a 5 on Spice level (1-10) and it was spicy. For spice lovers you will like this plate. It arrived with side portion of white rice and egg roll. Plenty of food for a grown male adult.  Besides the wait I will highly recommend this restaurant.

XzqC2CMkidch6gPqRbJUXA.text: Great little Thai spot near Doubletree hotel; I had the L-Pad Thai Shrimp. It was fresh and very tasty. Will definitely return when in the area.

00ogceCYuNb39aMo4deSiw.text: This place is soooooo good. So delicious. I am from southern CA and I'm surrounded by really good Thai food. But I if I could I would move all of those other places out and bring I Am Thai Cuisine in to take their places. Now, sadly, I have to wait until I'm back in Vegas to indulge.

ZfbDR8phmIumv7ZycnauSA.text: Fantastic food! I had yellow curry with chicken & it was delicious. Service was sub par & the strip mall it was located in was a little scary.

I9jwkz9xdrNJ6DsOC_pCuA.text: I'm very particular about my pad thai but this place has a good flavor. Noodles were a little soggy that I'm use to but still edible. My daughter and I ate it up!

oqVjOkHEGS8Fej6TNX7qbQ.text: Came here again after a year. Still amazing service. Everything is good. I tried pork skewers and do not like pork but wanted to try something different and I came second time in a row for more. So good it becomes HIGHLY ADDICTIVE. My boss lives in La and when she comes for work she will come here everyday to eat because food taste so good.

Z7OsnaTK72fzy9ZwTzOUbw.text: So obviously I had a different experience, and it was lovely.  The presentation on these meals are so beautiful, you can tell that they put so much effort into their dishes!  Service was so much better this time around! She was absolutely lovely and was constantly on top of everything.  The chef came out and was so sweet, explained the rubber duck area, and it was so sweet.  (You should check it out, to know the answer ) they've changed the ambience from the last time I was there, and I'm thankful for it.  It changed it entirely, and I definitely think this is a place to go to! For a nice dinner, for a lovely date, it will cover all bases, and have amazing food in the process.  I'm glad they changed up a few things it made all the difference in the world and is appreciate.   Ooo real quick, on their specials board was the Tom yum fried rice... ummm omg that was awesome, it was spicy, and slightly salty, but you throw some lime on top (which they provide) and it's just, wow! Have that with some Thai ice tea, and you have an amazing meal... Mmm that sounds super amazing, I believe I'll be heading towards my leftovers now.

33EOR6Fx8WDPfeZihnVMYQ.text: I've had everything from crab fried rice, to BBQ chicken, to pad Thai.  I've never had a bad bite at this place, a hidden little gem.

HQlazcwYn5CydquNQ89PGQ.text: I was very happy with both the food and service here. I like things really hot, and they certainly delivered on that. You do need to order a few numbers down from your usual. They will bring the spice jars/sauces on the side, but I didn't need them.  Tom Kha soup with shrimp was good. The Small was a pretty large portion, had three shrimp. Good flavor.  The Nam Tok with beef salad was really good as well. Great texture and flavors.  The two ladies who served me were very sweet and attentive. Will definitely keep on my list!!!

uvJ21c_G6DaPpXpyNVeuQw.text: Search no more! I'm seriously very excited I found this place. This is authentic thai food. I visited Thailand last year and had the best duck curry I've ever tasted there, I've been searching for a place as good for a year.  This is it.   5 stars because it's everything I expect from a good thai restaurant. Relaxing environment, attentive service, and excellent food.  Boyfriend and I got the papaya salad, tom yum kung soup, pineapple fried rice, spicy beef salad, and duck curry. Everything was made to perfection. The food was full of aroma and flavor. If you like thai food, give this place a try. You won't leave disappointed.

FE6Y0LWJryFNqpANj1YytA.text: Visited a couple of days ago and would definitely recommend this if you're in the area.  The restaurant is clean, the servers are attentive, and the food had good flavor.  We tried the Tom Yum soup with shrimp, the bowl has 5-6 shrimp in it and a sweet flavored broth, Pad See Eiw with beef, and the Scallop Chu Chee.  We've had these dishes before at other restaurants but never the Scallop dish; the dish consisted of four seared scallops on a bed of noodles which resembled a creamy chow mein.  All in all a great meal and definitely a place we'd return to when we're in Las Vegas again.

rNWx-IaPkj3qcV7gPMCXag.text: I mistakenly rated this restaurant "One Star". They deserve a Five Star rating!  Please see my original review - the commentary says it all. Highly recommended.   We will come back here the next time we are in Vegas.

nr4AfWc91-PPDIVkG5pFKg.text: The location is in a non descript location next to a gas station. The inside is older but in a well kept condition. Now the good parts. The food was excellent for the price. Large portion and the right taste. The service was also excellent. Lots of refills and attentive service. Great gem. Will be back.

PjPC0JYpit98IOsUWg_wCw.text: Highly recommend this restaurant!  We felt as if we were in a private home being served a Thai meal.  The service was so nice and helpful.  The food was super delicious!  We had six people in our party, and had a large variety of food.  Not one bad bite!  I'd say, my go to next time will be the Thai Beef Salad.  The beef was so tender, the salad was a nice mix of fresh greens and the dressing...YUM! Next time you're in Vegas, get off the strip, and get some really good Thai food!

h8ZvA0Qldq8PX8JpZ0ns0w.text: Such a great find after shopping at the outlet mall.  We ordered 6 entrees, 2 appetizers, and a soup.  Everything was delicious, fresh and flavorful.  Family friendly and great for big groups.

bM5GUSeqn14QZ_MtHtKABQ.text: This place was stupid good. I mean so so good. Excellent service and 10/5 stars for taste. I wish they were located closer to my home in California!

VYj3sce3HG9KEzofYHRxcw.text: The service was good, and we got our food at a decent time but the downfall was that we all got food poisoning from it. Just want to warn others.

hqprIPq0Qx7ILpKd5tQBtw.text: While traveling back to our house from Town Square we saw this quaint Thai restaurant that had great reviews! We decided to stop in and try it since we're huge fans of Thai food!   I ordered the Pad See Ew with beef and medium spice (7-8 out of 10 scale) and it was some of the best I have had in the last ten years if not the best! The fried egg was cooked to the perfect consistency and had an excellent texture, the beef was tender, juicy, and flavorful.  My fiancee ordered the Pad Thai with chicken low spice, the noodles were not over cooked (a problem I've had at other places when I get Pad Thai), I'm not a fan of chicken and loved how the seasoning made the chicken taste! The peanuts and bean sprouts were extremely fresh!  We started with the crab rangoons which were compact and well cooked, the accompanying sweet and sour was perfect!  The service was quick, extremely friendly, and held great conversations between plates being delivered.  I would definitely take the time to stop by again next time I'm in Vegas.

SwiFPafCvSVLKihgXbHrCQ.text: Amazing food. I had the pineapple curry and it was delicious. The service was great and it was a nice atmosphere.

4tdCByugptfgGOi0EruYgw.text: First off let me just tell you that this is worth getting off the strip. It is a short drive but the atmosphere is super relaxing. That was a huge deal to me first. Second, the staff was unrelentingly helpful and extremely courteous.   Then this is where it got real for me and the person I was with. We noticed the level of detail that was being shown by how the food was presented. WE did not expect what we began to find out. The server who was taking care of us did have an accent and we inquired where. Native to Thailand, He and his family came over 15 years ago and finally have been able to live out there dream. His mother who is the primary cook is phenomenal. This is authentic stuff not the overly salty overly flavored junk you get other places. IT comes down to this, if you want the real deal come here its worth it.

7qoPI1MFJjHiDvxkPUPiRA.text: Presentation is key in fine dining but never expected in hard to find gems like I am Thai   Friendly owners on site and service was exceptional     as well as the food. Will be coming back for more soon.

sJKhdI9g4NYk2oKWdmHAWA.text: Great and really fresh Thai food. Had the wonton soup and it like no other wonton soup I've had before. It a little different than your typical Thai food. The chef is doing something right and making a name for himself. Highly recommend!

cwlKguDeV3Z0CcAOk9LbTQ.text: I am sad to give my first bad review. I waited forty minutes for my food. The servers never refilled my water or checked in on me except once--when they brought me the wrong food.  The salad was iceberg with a generic honey mustard. The lunch menu states that you get soup, egg roll, and a salad with your entree, but when I ordered, I was asked soup OR salad. I had ordered a yellow curry, but it was too sweet for me to finish.   I do give one star for the atmosphere, though. It is spacious and clean as are the restrooms.  The music is not too loud and the lighting is perfect--brightly lit for the dark wood atmosphere.  The other star is for the lunch price. It was $7.95.   I will give this place another try some time as I don't like to write things off based on one experience only. Hopefully my first time experience was just a fluke.

3ub-xoSyWHuDlWXSN1bS8Q.text: Shit! This food was absolutely delicious. We tried crab rangoon, and beef jerkey for apps. Then grabbed fresh ginger and spicy rice. Then we took naps at the table. Thank you for the checkin coke. I needed that...

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Basil Rice, Beef Jerky, Crab Ragoon, and sommore good shit!

XHi1oNSXaKld5JzerfeQUw.text: This is one of our favorite Thai restaurants in Las Vegas. The food is fabulous and the pricing very reasonable. Although be warned, their medium spicy is equivalent to extra spicy in other places. They now have their liquor license which is nice.

8LA1LwkmSyMnyJCp_owclw.text: We obviously did a yelp as we typically do and found this restaurant, which supposedly had a 5 rating. Well I would say a 5, really is a 4. The ambiance was nice and the service was very good. The food was good, not excellent. We had Crispy Fish with Curry, that was good and curry very flavorful. Had the Tom Gak Coconut soup, a bit salty, however flavorful with fresh mushrooms. I had the drunken noodles, which they call Pad Kee Mou, very different from what I've had before but good. If your in the area, a good place to go. I prefer Arawan or Ni-tai-yas

iXicXq5_GasCcrVth5OyMQ.text: My husband and I decided to try a new Thai place and of course I Am Thai came up with great reviews, so we decided to give this place a shot and order Togo. We walk in and the atmosphere was good but dark, there was only one customer eating there, the lady at the desk wasn't very friendly and lacked a lot of customer service. If I would have met her before I placed my order I would have just left that place but I had ordered ahead of time through yelp... We ordered Sum Tum I Am and Tum Yum Noodles. Sum tum i am did not even look appetizing at all. The chicken was over cooked and hard with no flavoring to it what so ever. The rice was old, you can tell they froze the rice and microwaved it, and the papaya salad wasn't even that good it lacked a lot of flavoring just like the rest of the order. The tum tum noodles were horrible, it wasn't hot or sour, it just tasted bland. We'd give them 0 stars if we could.

photos.caption: Photo of I Am Thai Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qFr1EVm1EZ8fWTOVcEa2Ug.text: Great food! Lots of flavor and choices.

lpCn5fw_XYuqSnx6szYIdA.text: We finally found the best Thai food in Las Vegas! This is so much better than anything else I've had here in town. We came in on a Sunday and it wasn't very crowded at all. The pad Thai was off the chain, and the green Curry fried rice was something we had never had before, and it blew us away. The staff was amazingly kind and helpful, drink glasses never got below half full. The duck fried rice is also amazing! Do yourself a favor and try this little mom-and-pop gem, you'll be back time and again.

DKoTltq2Mneb51F5Nphizg.text: Ate here for lunch and had the lunch curry. Fair price for good portion, and a 5 was actually spicey! They also have several vegetarian options.

b4KF4HCCaJhcyYgmNbbh9g.text: The massaman curry and spicy eggplant were amazing with really great flavor. The cucumber salad and Thai icetea were very good. The service was great and no drink at the table went dry. Try it! I think you will really enjoy it!

y074FvafYWAuZI5i2AzKgQ.text: Visiting town for spring break and popped into this gem. Came late but we were warmly greeted. Super friendly,  relaxing atmosphere and service. Had a simple meal of crab rangoon and wonton soup. Surprisingly,  delightfully flavorful and fresh! Highly recommend and we will be coming back again!  Ps. My husband had panang curry and asked for 6 level spicy which equals an 8 for Americans. He says it was excellently spicy and the best panang he's had.

IRabSi7agBD5yNw1AcEe-w.text: I love this place, and it's so close to the airport, I stop by almost immediately I come to town.

la3MYxfFCKGlHmzP7szDUQ.text: Hidden gem is an overstatement from other yelpers. Good thai food, but not great. Sadly they ran of duck which is the reason why I wanted to come here. Chicken satay was kind of a joke. Very thin pieces. Pad thai was ok, very sticky. But the curry was very good and so was the crab fried rice. Thai tea was delicious, but sweet roti was eh. Service was great at the beginning but then very slow at the end waiting to get the check and it was not busy at all. Archi's takes the cake

Y6EdRC3RzMBuamnWPatfZw.text: Their pad thai is AMAZING! I recommend it to anyone who goes. Make sure to get a some when you visit.

qPRykfh4hGfjfFK-Z-QRYQ.text: Good food.  I enjoy the Panang. I have been here a few times.  I am not giving 5 stars because I went there today and it took forever to get service.  The lady that waited on us didn't know that the person I was with spoke Thai.  She told another employee "I have to hurry up and wait on these unhappy butt faces".   It was funny to me but they should be careful what they say.

EhuflQwrVXkF5V_hsIQpiA.text: Stopped by for a quick lunch prior to a flight. This is very close to the car rental center. The service was quick and friendly. The menu is standard for a Thai restaurant. The lunch specials are well priced at $7.95 including a main dish, soup or salad, and small egg roll. The spicy basil (I got chicken) was very good. The egg drop soup was ok. Thai iced tea also very good. Just be warned that he medium spicy was making me cry, and I really like spicy food. So it will probably come out spicier than you think! Parking is easy in a lot out front.

7fGW8TGh-LujxEKC8-wUZA.text: This place is amazing, even if food allergies are a concern.  We ordered several courses and one or the other of us has allergies to wheat, peanut, shellfish, dairy and corn.  Our waitress Tara checked with the chef on everything to be sure we could eat the variety of dishes we ordered.  the service was impeccable and the food was fabulous.  The chicken satay was the best I have ever had, our soup delicious, and the two entrees perfect for our individual allergies and palettes.  We will definitely eat here anytime we are in Vegas!

1b2GUiGtRlcV8NdFyJ1YNQ.text: Overall we were disappointed given the high Yelp ratings. Will not come back next time we are in the area.  Liked: - All water containers are made of glass. - Pad Thai tasted good.  Disliked: - Service was very slow for no good reason. The table near ours got their food much faster. - Red Curry with level 1 spicy (mild) was similar to level 3+ at other Thai places. The portion is small too. - There were suspicious residuals in our water cups before we drank it.

NDuRlrRDNmAL8z32lKO9Aw.text: They had me when they asked if I wanted it vegan Very nice people working there and great vibes. Been there three times and it has always been great. My omni husband and cousins loved it. Highly recommend.

yKk7yNcVIKAg01IcGmSPpA.text: Decided to come here for take out on a rainy night. Food was good and had lots of flavors. Service was good and staff were great! Very prompt! Definitely coming back and trying other dishes on the menu. Prices are reasonable, unlike some other places!

ZJDrXrpfF9iyLAmU8jH2gg.text: Very nice Thai place.   Pleasant environment and service and larger menu.  Had the green chicken curry which was very nice but the portion could have been larger for a male costumer. The smaller wonton soup bowl  was big enough for two and was also tasty.  Server was new and inexperienced but her pleasant attitude made up for it

ye87WD7fwPYSv6UDN8i5NQ.text: What an absolutely delightful experience. Never expected to find small town hospitality like we did at this restaurant in the heart of Las Vegas. The food was amazing. Wish there was one closer to Kansas loved this experience. If you go you must try the Thai dumplings, trust me!

kKcnnBwxhjzNyvFbwFvGLw.text: This place was great!! Had the most amazing Nom Tuk.  Oredered level8 spice and it was hot!!! But oh so delicious.  Also had some Panang curry and brown rice and it was also delish.

Xa-CLHeeewEiMG7omRXXTg.text: Extremely clean, beyond friendly, and ridiculously GOOD. Great prices too. This was seriously just an all over amazing experience. Everyone in our party LOVED their food and I have never seen a cleaner restaurant, honestly. They were so sweet, played with my kids and brought my toddler candy. We will eat here every time we come to visit!!

Ig8wW2ZdIhRO8VGJt20I0A.text: A Highlight of our Las Vegas trip. We were here on Christmas night. The food was so delicious and so cheap that we chose to come here again right before we fly back. The waitress here is so friendly and she told us that the owner personally make sure that every dish is perfect before it's served to the customer.

m82McixOCq0_AAMUBq8yag.text: Amazing Thai food, wonderful staff and service. This is a restaurant that makes you feel at home with dishes that are among the best of Thai in all of Las Vegas. Highly recommend. Had the Seafood Red Thai Curry...magnificent! Thank you "I Am Thai Cuisine"!

1DKngLalK4XjBNJ_18TJ1Q.text: Excellent Thai. Very authentic and reasonably priced. Even they didn't mind that we were the last to arrive at 9:30pm for dining in.

OjVJZnOpxZCZBfbVf38L0g.text: Bomb Thai Food here, don't hesitate just go here!!! you will not be disappointed! I got the Pad see eww, green curry, and pineapple curry, and I ordered a 6 spice level which was spicier than normal compared to places like Lucky Thai, and Galangha spots so beware.
